texts.en: Sami is a 28-year-old married man from Ramallah. In 2010 Sami opened his own cafeteria. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy chairs and tables for the cafeteria, since there is a school nearby and this would help him bring in more customers.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for his cafeteria

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en:
Zeddy is a mother of two children aged 18 and 5 with both still schooling. She has been in mixed farming in her home area of Litein, South Rift, Kenya for 15 years. Her family fully relies on farming for their upkeep. She currently produces tea, milk and pineapples for the local market. She has two farmhands who help her with farming.

Zeddy has requested Juhudi Kilimo to advance her a second loan of 70,000 KES to buy a heifer at 30,000 KES and  a chuff cutter to use to make the feed for the animals. She says she will be able to pay for the education of the two children. She had previously received a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo.

Zeddy remains grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services offered.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and a heifer.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys tiene 25 años de edad, está casada con el señor Denis quien tiene 25 años de edad, ambos nacidos en la ciudad de Caacupé. La pareja tiene 1 hija  de 6 años.
Gladys comenta que tiene un copetín donde trabaja mucho y más en este tiempo cuando se acerca la fecha del aniversarios de la virgen de Caacupé, donde la venta de comestibles aumenta considerablemente por la concentración de gente por la zona. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y ser una gran empresaria
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, hortalizas, panificados, condimentos y demás insumos que necesita para hacer los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
Gladys is 25 years old. She is married to Denis, 25 years old. They were both born in the city of Caacupé. They have one daughter, 6 years old.

Gladys says that she has a fast food counter where she works a lot, and even more so now around the feast of the virgin of Caacupé, when food sales increase considerably due to the number of people in the area. One of her dreams is to be able to continue growing and be a great businesswoman. 

She is asking for the loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, bread products, condiments, and other supplies that she needs to make the food she sells.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, vegetables, bread products, condiments, and other supplies

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 53 years old. She has one child, aged 11. Her husband works as farmer. She has sold foodstuffs for the period of 20 years. With the loan, she will buy more foodstuffs, most especially bananas. With the extra profits, she will buy a bicycle for helping with transportation and distribution in the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: María Benildes

texts.es: María Benildes de 44 años de edad, reside con sus hijos en la zona occidental del país. Es una mujer luchadora, honesta y trabajadora que su mayor ilusión siempre ha sido brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  María es ama de casa, aunque también se dedica a la agricultura y a su vez es comerciante, ya que vende lo que produce. Recibe ayuda por parte de su hermano que reside fuera del pais y es así como ella solventa un poco los gastos de su hogar.  Ella desea invertir en su cosecha, es decir, producir más para venderlo de igual manera y así poder tener la plena confianza que nunca hará falta el pan en su casa. Es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos como: Abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Agradece la ayuda de antemano y cuenta con la seguridad que la cosecha de esta temporada que viene le mejorara aun mas su condición de vida.

loans.use: Para la compra de insumos como: Abonos, Semillas, Fertilizantes, Pesticidas etre otros

loans.name: Les Genies Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LES GENIES est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, nommée Feyekola Claudia (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 29 ans est mariée et a un enfant, qui n’est pas encore scolarisé mais à la charge de Feyekola Claudia et son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Feyekola Claudia a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Pour pouvoir faire face, aux besoins de sa famille, Feyekola Claudia vend des tissus et des chaussures par la méthode de distribution depuis six ans. Feyekola Claudia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et à Lomé au TOGO. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Feyekola Claudia sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LES GENIES un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des chaussures.

loans.name: Señor De Ccoyllority De Huayllabamba Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority de Huayllabamba”, provincia de Urubamba  y de departamento de Cusco. 
La socia Yovana tiene 38 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose   a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son arroz,acuar,leche ,gaseosas entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Señor de Ccoyllority de Huayllabamba” communal bank in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Yovana is 38 years old.  She divides her time between her daily chores and a grocery store business.  She has been working at this business for quite a while now, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She sells rice, sugar, milk, and soda, among other items—whatever her customers ask her for.  She wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family.

She is asking for this loan for the purchase of rice and sugar, among other items.

The group members are grateful for the granted loan and are committed to making their established payments.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Gadagodo

texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Tabligbo, Mr. Gadagodo S. is married and is the father of four (4) children. He is a motorcycle mechanic and sells spares for bicycles in Tsévié. Having not completed primary school for lack of support, he had to learn mechanics for motorcycles and bicycles in his native village. This career which he has been practicing for ten years is not sufficient really to completely meet the family needs due to the insufficiency of his working capital. So he requested and got an initial credit of $500 which he has repaid without incident to strengthen his business of selling spares. With his sense of good management, Mr. Gadagodo S. deserves to be supported financially to increase his businesses. Thus, he is requesting a credit of $1,200 to buy spares in Nigeria and to resell them in Tsévié. This project will increase his income allowing him to better take care of his family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1963 à Tabligbo, Monsieur S. Gadagodo est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Il est mécanicien 2 roues et vend à Tsévié, des pièces détachées pour vélo. N’ayant même terminé le cours primaire par manque de support, il a dû apprendre la mécanique à deux roues dans son village natal. Ce métier qu’il exerce depuis 10 ans, ne suffit pas réellement pour prendre totalement en charge les besoins de sa famille pour insuffisance de son fonds de roulement. Alors, il a sollicité et obtenu un premier crédit de $500 qu’il a bien remboursé sans incident pour renforcer son commerce de pièces détachées. Ayant le sens de bon gestionnaire, Monsieur S. Gadagodo mérite d’être soutenu financièrement pour accroître ses affaires. Aussi, sollicite-t-il un crédit de $1200 pour acheter les pièces détachées au Nigéria pour venir les revendre à Tsévié. Ce projet augmentera ses revenus lui permettant de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy and sell spares

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used toys in bulk for sale

loans.name: Michael Nyongesa

texts.en: Michael is a trained mason. He started his business in 1994.  He builds houses and also sells gravel stones.  He is also an active member of his community’s VCT Centre where he does guiding and counseling.  Through his business, he has brought skills to the community. He has also been able to educate his three children, who are all in primary school. His wife is a housewife.  He has gained experience throughout the years he has been in business and this has in turn enabled him to get more customers.  With a loan from PEMCI, he plans to purchase construction tools, and also purchase a bicycle to enable him to improve his transportation business.

loans.use: To Purchase Construction Tools

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Business Description

Isabel got started selling crabs. Since she had to travel every week and that was too much of an effort, her father encouraged her to offer restaurant services. With his support, she was able to buy cooking utensils. She began selling five meals a day for lunch. Currently, she has a clientele that surpasses 20 customers everyday. She works during the weekends from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m. She gets help from her mom and dad for the preparation of the meals

Loan Use

She will invest the loan in buying supplies. She is also planning to purchase sodas, beverages and juices. Additionally, she is thinking of buying chickens once her income has increased.

Personal Information

Isabel is 39 years old and single. Eighteen years ago she suffered the loss of her 2-month-old son. She lives with her parents and seven siblings. They are all adults and they take care of their parents. Three years ago, her father had prostate surgery and this left her with little money. Her parents are her inspiration in order to keep going. She is hoping to build a house of concrete in the future. She currently lives in a house built with mixed materials.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Isabel se inicio con la venta de cangrejos. Por los que tenia que viajar todas las semanas. Actividad que le demandaba mucho esfuerzo. Su papa la motivo para que venda comida. Con su ayuda pudo comprar utensilios de cocina. Comenzó vendiendo 5 almuerzos. Actualmente tiene una clientela que sobrepasa las 20 personas diarias. Trabaja los fines de semana en horario de 5 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Recibe la ayuda de su papa y mama en la preparación de la comida.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de víveres. Además piensa comprar colas, bebidas, jugos. Otra parte poder invertir en pollos. Con lo que mejorara sus ingresos.

Información Personal

Isabel es soltera. Tiene 39 años. Hace 18 años sufrió la perdida de su hijo de la edad de 2 meses de nacido. Ella vive con sus padres y 7 hermanos. Todos ya adultos y pendientes de sus padres. Hace 3 meses su papa fue operado de la próstata. Lo que ha ella la dejo un poco sin capital. Sus padres son lo que ha ella la motiva a seguir trabajando. Esperando a futuro poder construir su casa de cemento. Actualmente es de construcción mixta.

loans.use: Investing in buying supplies

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Mrs. Ty N., 46, lives in the Siem Reap province of Camboida with her 4 children. She is a widow, and earns money for her family by selling souvenir products and earning $5 a day. 2 of her children are students, and the other 2 work as tour guides. Mrs. Ty N. has requested this loan because she would like to build a new house for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Thoi Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Thoi has been in the job of junk dealing for many years. In this work, she travels through the street salvaging junk that she sells to businesses who can reuse the material, e.g. metals and plastics. She has found it more and more difficult to earn enough income from this job. She has decided to diversify her income sources by generating income through buying baby chickens to raise and sell in the market. Fortunately, she has been introduced to the microfinance program of Binhminh cdc where she can obtain a loan to implement her plan.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for raising

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
When we came to the Don Ricardo’s small farm, the first thing that called our attention was the big number of fruit trees that he possesses, and all the immense effort that this man puts in the production of each of his fruits, working with good fortitude and spirit. Ricardo is the father of three daughters who are still in school, they are the reason, he works constantly since he thinks that the best gift that he can give them is a suitable education. Ricardo has always had the desire to be able to build his house in Perené and buy a three-wheeler van to be able to work during his free hours, but he hasn’t been able to do it, due to the multiple expenses he always has. With the loan, Ricardo will be able to have a bigger production of his citrus fruits next year and this way he will be able to achieve his goals. Let's help Ricardo’s dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando llegamos a la chacra de don Ricardo, lo primero que llamó nuestra atención fue la gran cantidad de árboles frutales que posee, y sobretodo el inmenso esfuerzo que este hombre pone en la producción de cada una de sus frutas, laborando con un muy buen ánimo y espíritu Ricardo es padre de tres hijas quienes aún están en etapa escolar, razón por la cual trabaja constantemente ya que considera que el mejor regalo que puede otorgarles es una educación adecuada. Ricardo también ha tenido siempre el deseo de poder construir su casa en Perené y el de comprarse un motocarro, para poder trabajar en sus horas libres, sin embargo no ha podido hacerlo por los múltiples gastos que ha diario tiene. A través de un préstamo, podrá tener una mayor producción de sus cítricos el próximo año y de esta manera podrá lograr sus metas. Contribuyamos a hacer realidad los sueños de Ricardo.

loans.use: Have a bigger working capital to increase the quality and production of his products.

loans.name: Nansana West I B(Ii) A Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Diana sells and distributes water to the local people. She intends to use the extra profits to buy a water tower which can accommodate more than one tank. The tower will increase the quantity of water for sale.

loans.use: To buy more containers for water storage

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en: Tuti is currently 32 years old and married. Her husband has no fixed job, and she must support her family by selling plastics. Tuti earns a net profit of $2 a day, and is requesting a loan of $175 to provide tuition for her children. She is planning to repay her loan in a total of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to business capital

loans.name: Petalo De Rosa, Group 3

texts.en:
Miomis (pictured far left) is 34 years old and lives with her four children in the town of L. Alcarrizzos on the outskirts of the capital, Santo Domingo. She runs a successful business from her home selling new clothing, some jewelry and beauty items, and a small selection of shoes—she calls her business “El Rinconcito.” She has applied for this loan so that she can buy a larger selection of merchandise, and at a bulk price—that way she will be able to both offer her clients more choice and increase her profit margin.

Her dreams are to see her business grow enough so that her children can continue their studies and one day she will be able to see them become professionals. She also has ambitions to expand her business and make it bigger, stronger, and more widely known.

Miomis’ biggest challenge right now comes from renting her house. While renting, she is forced to pay a high price for a house that is of poor quality. She hopes that this loan will help her save more money towards buying her own house one day soon. In the little free time that she has, Miomis says she loves to read.

On behalf of Miomis and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support of this loan!

loans.use: Purchase new clothing, jewelry and shoes in bluk at wholesale prices

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Mrs. Pech C., 43, is a grocer in Trapaing Angkrorng Village. She has six children, two of whom are working in construction and earn around US$5 a day, while the other two attend school. Pech's husband, Chum Peach, grows sugar palm in the village. Typically, Pech spends around US$52.20 per month on regular family expenses as well as wedding ceremonies and funerals. In order to cover the family's expenses, she would like to receive a loan to buy more groceries for sale in her store.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Iris Johanna's Group

texts.en:
Iris Johanna is twenty-nine years old and coordinator of a group of five women that carry on different businesses in the San Luis community of Santo Domingo.  Iris Johanna sells shoes and silver jewelry through a catalog.
She explains that she has been running her business for three years, and has been trying very hard to grow it.  Iris also says that she doesn’t have a local to operate the business, but she plans to rent a small shop when she’ll have put sufficient money aside and have the necessary amount of capital to do so.
Iris is asking for a loan to buy more goods to add to her stock in order to meet her customers’ needs.  She will receive the funds together with the following entrepreneurs:
Ana Lilian C., a clothing retailer
Ileini Orquidia P., to buy materials for her beauty salon
María Irlanda P. C., to buy silver jewels.
Zuleika M. A., for a small jewelry shop.
Photo: From left to right: Iris Johanna, Ana Lilian, Ileini, María Irlanda, and Zuleika.

loans.use: To bulk-buy silver jewels and shoes to move expand her business

location.town: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Sevara

texts.en: Sevara M. is 20 years old and married.  Sevara has been an active client of  MicroInvest since 2007, and has had no problems with loan repayments.  Her business provides her with income stability, which thereby allows her to return loans.  Sevara is engaged in her family's business of raising livestock. She has ten years of experience in this  business and developed the necessary  professional skills.  Sevara is now applying for a loan of $775 for eight months to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase another milk cow.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Albertina M. is single and over 65 years old. She was born in Xaka Ni Mizi, known as Kilometer 18. She was able to complete the 3rd grade and then had to stop because of her parents’ social and economic conditions.

Albertina has 5 children. The oldest lives in South Africa and works as a miner, and the youngest is 25 years old, studied until the 9th grade, and is currently working as a fisherman. Albertina also supports 4 grandchildren who live with their respective mothers in the same plot.

Because of the military conflict, Albertina took refuge in Maputo with her family. She learned to work the land from her father, and has been working in agriculture for 23 years. Her day begins at 6:00 and ends at 10:00. She has no employees. The money she makes from agriculture goes toward supporting the family.

Albertina lives in her own house, and this is her 8th loan. The first 3 were for building her home, and the others were for the fishing business. She found out about Hluvuku through credit officials. In the future Albertina intends to finish her house, fix her fishing boat, and if possible, save some money for other needs.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Albertina M., solteira maior de 65 anos de idade, nasceu em Xaka ni mizi conhecido por Kilómetro 18, estudou até 3ª classe e não teve possibilidade de continuar devido as condições sociais e económicas dos seus pais. Tem 5 filhos sendo que o mais velho tem 36 anos e trabalha na África do Sul como mineiro e o mais novo tem 25 anos estudou até 9ª classe e actualmente é pescador, todavia sustenta 4 netos e vivem no mesmo quintal embora com as respectivas mães. Devido ao conflito armado tinha se refugiado na cidade de Maputo junto com a familia. Actualmente dedica-se a agricultura e faz este trabalho a 23 anos, inicia as 6:00 e termina as 10:00mn e não tem empregados e relata que aprendeu com o pai. Basicamente o rendimento da agricultura é para sustento da familia. Albertina M. Vive em casa própria e já beneficiou de 8 empréstimos sendo que os 1º a 3º foi para Habitação e os restantes para pesca e teve conhecimento da existencia da hluvuku atraves de trabalhos de divulgação pelos oficiais de crédito. No futuro pretende terminar com a obra de sua casa e reparação do barco e se possivel poupar para algumas necessidades.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her boat

loans.name: Abdulsabor

texts.en:
Abdulsabor G. is 20 years old, single and lives with his family. For the last five years he has run a small cosmetics shop in a crowed part of Kabul. Business is good, and he is applying for this loan to enlarge his shop and buy more items, including clothing, to sell to his customers.

Adbulsabor will pay the loan back in 18 months, and would like to thank Kiva and its lenders for their support. He is confident that this loan will help him expand his business, and that he will be able to pay it back in a timely manner.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Salama's Tukubaliane Group

texts.en:
Salama is 20 years old. She is married. She has run her own shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Salama is now requesting a loan to buy more commmodities for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwayaka.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Taufau

texts.en:
Taufau T. is 35 years old and married with seven children. She has many years of experience selling bananas and taro. She sells her fruits and vegetables in her village and to the public three days a week.

Taufau has benefited from three successful SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) loans. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~$145 USD). SPBD loans are Taufau's only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. She will use her loan to improve her banana- and taro-selling business by purchasing seeds and pesticides. Her husband will also help her to operate the business.

loans.use: To improve her banana- and taro-selling business by purchasing seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra Baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 20 years. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. They all are free and don’t do anything. Bushra Baji’s husband is a loader by profession. He loads different items (fruits, sugarcane and vegetables). He doesn’t have his own donkey cart. Bushra Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart for her husband so that he is able to take the whole amount of his load.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Taj Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Jamila Baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Maryam Baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for loading

loans.name: Shahrior

texts.en:
Shahrior owns a minivan and provides transportation services. His usual itinerary is the Kanibadam-Khujand-Kanibadam route. Having run this business for the past five years, he has gained much experience. Initially, he rented the car, but after making certain savings, he bought his own minivan, with the support of his father. 

The business is stable and generates the main income for Shahrior’s family, thereby allowing an improvement in their living conditions. To be able to decrease the expenses for the fuel and consequently to reduce the fees for his services, Shahrior is planning to replace the fuel supply system with the system that uses the gas. This system will be much cheaper than petrol. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni. Abdunazar thanks everyone who is supporting him and promises to repay the loan in 11 months.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Nhưng  55 tuổi, chị có 4 con trong đó 3 con đã trưởng thành. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị Nhưng rất khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm các con còn nhỏ. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ và vay vốn để  đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Hiện tại đây là công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị.Ngoài ra hàng tháng chị cũng có thêm sự giúp đỡ của các con đã đi làm nên cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm hàng phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của người dân đại phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Ms. V. Thi Nhung is 55 years old. She has 4 children and 3 are grown. Before joining TYM fund, her family's economic situation was quite difficult. Her husband died at an early age while the children were still young. In 2004, she joined the fund to borrow money to invest in a grocery store. Presently, the store is her family's main source of income. She also has additional monthly help from her grown children who also work, so the family's economic situation is getting more stable by the day. For the next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to buy additional merchandise as requested by the customers for the upcoming Tet Holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Phach

texts.en: Mr. Y., 39, is a rice farmer as well as an oxen trader. Normally, he finds oxen and buys them from villagers at a negotiated price and keeps them to fatten for while to sell at a higher price for profit. He started this business in 1998, while his wife, Mrs. Kimhoeurn, 32, works farming rice. He has two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. With a view to growing his business, Y. needs a loan to use as capital for oxen trading.

loans.use: to use as capital for oxen trading

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Lillian P. from Mwanza. She is married with six children between the ages of seven and 17 years old. Lillian has been running a tailoring business since 2004. Her business is to make clothes and sell them to her customers. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Lillian currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy threads and kanga. In the future, she plans to add more different cloths. Lillian thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy threads and kanga

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como empleado en una mina aurífera en la misma provincia .
 
Vive. en la comunidad Vilaque de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su hogar. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Edgar raises cattle and sells the milk to PIL Andina (Milk Industrialization Plant). He also works in the gold mine of his home province. He lives in the community of Vilaque in the province Loa Andes, department of La Paz, three hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who works with him in all his chores, both with their livestock and with their home. He will use the loan to buy a milk cow and so increase his milk production as well as his income. This is his second loan with Impro, the evaluation we carried out determined that he qualifies for the loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Luisa del Carmen G. M. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Luisa se dedica a la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de doce años que se dedica este negocio, pero este negocio lo ha iniciado con capital propio para la ayuda de la manutención de su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Luisa son de son de obtener ingresos con su negocio ya que este es el único medio de supervivencia. El financiamiento es destinado par capital de trabajo ya que con esto podrá comprar productos como: golosinas, pan, granos básicos y otros. Sus sueños son de convertir su pequeño negocio en una distribuidora que ofrezca lo necesario. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 9.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
La Señora Luisa del Carmen G. M. is 58 years old and married. Doña Luisa is dedicated to running a convenience store. For over twelve years she has been dedicated to this business, but this business was started with her own capital to help with the maintenance of her family. The purpose of Doña Luisa is to earn an income with her business since this is her only means of survival. The loan will be used as working capital to buy products such as: cookies, bread, basic grains and more. Her dreams are to convert her small business into that of a distributor that offers necessities. The amount that she requests is 9,500 Cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy cookies, bread, basic grains and more for her convenience store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
She is married with three children who are in school. Two of her children are working while the last born is still breast feeding. Ama T. is a 44 year old trader. She lives with her husband and children in a family house at Twifo Praso. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business.

She trades in cereals like maize, plantains, and others like cocoyam etc. She started this business four years ago. Ama makes a living through the profits she makes from her output and through this Ama has been very resourceful to her family.

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize, plantains and cocoyam to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes with the loan she can buy more bags of maize grains, plantains and others. She treks to the farming communities to buy her stock of goods. Ama belongs to a village bank called ‘Amen’. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy larger supply of maize, cocoyam and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.en:
Anatoliy is married. He runs a small business - owns a little shop where he offers his services as a car electrician. He has been in this business for 20 years. He does his job well, so people come back when they have new problems. Thus Anatoliy has many repeat clients and a stable income source.

In his business, Anatoliy uses special equipment that helps him to do diagnostics and repair. Anatoliy would like to borrow 13,800 UAH to purchase additional equipment. This would allow him to increase the number of services that he offers to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en:
Qadir T. is 37 years old and married with three children. Qadir sells cosmetics, washing powders, shampoo, and other items in the market. He has been in this business for six years. This activity generates the main income for Qadir’s family, which consist of three children and his wife.

Even though his store is not very big, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Qadir requests a $1500 loan to purchase more items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach S. was born in 1971 and resides with other family members in Siem Reap Province. She owns a medium-sized grocery store where she sells many wares to earn a living. She sells items such as cooked ingredients, soft drinks, canned foods and some snack foods for kids. She earns around of $5 a day to contribute to her family's living expenses.

She is married to Not Savy, age 36, who is a local statue carver. He owns a handicraft shop and has employees to provide his service. The couple has three children who are students and under their care.

Lach S. is applying for a loan to increase her business capital in order to better meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 49 years old and is currently single and the mother of a child. Her child is a trader in the community market where they live. Ellen lives with her child at Suhum at the eastern region of Ghana.

Ellen works very hard to provide for her business. She is determined to work hard to rent a store so that she can sell rather than hawking (selling door-to-door). To achieve that dream, she has been selling cosmetics with products like spray, powder, lip gloss, blouses and shear butter (shear butter, or shea butter, is a popular natural face and hair cream), etc., and sells through hawking.

Ellen has been in business for four years now. She says the selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make enough income to rent a store. She is very sure that your loan support will bring her the desired results she expects. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Isaiah’.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and shear butter to sell

loans.name: Susan Wairimu

texts.en: Susan is 26 years old, married to Lawrence Gachago, and the proud mother of two children. She owns a clothing business which is located along the Eldoret-Malaba highway. She has been in this business for the last four years. She expects that this loan will enable her to expand her business into a wholesale operation by allowing her to purchase more stock. She also hopes to diversify her business by opening a sausage shop, which she thinks will see high demand in the area. Susan was introduced to KADET by fellow business people who are already KADET clients. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for men and women

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
En 2005 cette femme a commencé le commerce des articles de friperie, elle est une revendeuse ambulante et va chercher sa clientèle de maison en maison. Elle a reçu des commandes de ses clients, pour les satisfaire, elle doit se réapprovisionner, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 03 ballots de friperie.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2005, this woman began selling used clothing. She does traveling sales, going looking for customers from door to door. She has orders from her customers and to satisfy them, she needs to stock up. For that reason she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy 3 bales of used clothing.

She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Nicolas Jose

texts.es: El joven Nicolás B. de 26 años de edad, habitante de la comarca los cedros, soltero vive con sus padre en casa propia, su objetivo es mejorar el nivel de vida para ofrecerle mayor comodidad, su planes es construir un anexo a su vivienda. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de conductor desde hace ocho meses, ha encontrado dificultades de financiamiento para cumplir sus planes. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piso y bloque y poder construir, lo cual estará con mas privacidad y sobre todo con una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Nicolás B. is a young man who is 26 years of age. He is single and lives in his own home with his father in the region of Los Cedros. He hopes to improve his standard of living so that he will be more comfortable. His plans include building an extension to his house. Nicolás has been working in Villa del Carmen for the past eight months as a truck driver.

He has encountered difficulty securing financing to complete his project. Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC, he will buy construction materials such as cement, iron, flooring, and blocks. These improvements will provide more privacy and give him a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build an extension to his house

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Marina es casada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Marina junto a su esposo tienen una ferretería en la selva ayacuchana, productos que también reparte al por mayor, además venD. gas, y D. la selva compra café.
Marina necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gas.
Los sueños D. Marina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tengan un trabajo estable y tener una tienda en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

loans.use: Para la compra de gas.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Bwawani borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is 43 year old woman.she is married and a mother of 5 children. Her  children are 23, 21, 19, 17,  and 9 years old.

Victoria has owned a clothing business for 5 years, she works 6 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Victoria`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan,Victoria hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina L. is a 24 year-old woman living in the town of Tulaele. She is married and has 2 infant-aged children. Christina owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Christina has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 650 WST a month from these activities. Christina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Christina is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Christina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 28 years old. Jerlyn is married and has two young children. To make a living, Jerlyn operates a "sari-sari" (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jerlyn has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jerlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jerlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Jerlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Humility and sacrifice are the guiding principles of Purificacion R.. She is 54 years of age and married but she is still determined to improve their way of living through her variety store business. She dreams of expanding her store by asking for additional capital of Php 5,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes that she will be able to obtain this loan for her family needs and for emergency purposes.

Purificacion has been blessed with eight children but two of them are already married and have their own families. Six of her children are still single and they are: Aileen - 29 years old, a college undergraduate; Georace King - 26 years old, a high school graduate; Garry - 22 years old, a high school graduate; Abegail - 20 years old; Gilbert - 16 years old; and Angela Marie - 9 years old, an elementary pupil.

Purificacion hopes that she will be able to continue to support the schooling of her youngest daughter.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for the expansion of her variety store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita V. is from the village of Guba Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, widowed and she has 4 adult children.

To make a living, Anita operates single motorcycle transportation services. Anita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita successfully repaid her first loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting her second loan of 15,000 PHP which she will use to repair existing vehicles for better service.

Anita plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicles for better service.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
This is Guillerma P., 54 years old, who lives and does business in Tala, Caloocan City. She lives with her husband Napoleon, 72, a retiree/pensioner, together with their three adult children.

Guillerma has a stall selling vegetables, fruits and rice. She has been in this business for seven years and has two paid helpers assisting her in the business. She earns P30, 000.00 a month which she saves to be able to venture into other businesses. She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. Guillerma is now on her fifteenth loan cycle. She is expecting a new loan from the cooperative in the amount of P14, 000.00 as additional capital. With this fresh capital, she can purchase more assorted fruits and vegetables for her business. She hopes to establish a grocery store soon.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: purchase of more assorted fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Rosemery

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosemery tiene 41 años de edad, se encuentra casada con el Sr. Javier rogelio Coca ya por 20 años, juntos tienen 3 hijas y 1 hijo, los cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona. Cuentan con casa propia en una zona que se dedica netamente a la lecheria y a la agricultura.
 
Ellos trabajan desde hace 10 años en la produccion de leche, han estado mejorando su produccion invirtiendo en la compra de mas cabezas de ganado lechero.

Ahora solicitan este credito para comprar una cabeza mas de una vaca lechera para poder incrementar su produccion de leche y asi mejorar sus ingresos. En un futuro estan dispuestos a solicitar un credito para comprar otra cabeza de una vaca lechera y seguir mejorando su produccion.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosemery is 41 years old, she has been married to Mr. Javier Rogelio Coca for 20 years. They have 3 daughters and 1 son who attend the local school.

For the past 10 years they have been dedicated to the production of milk, they have improved the production as they have bought more milking cows.

At the moment they request this loan to buy one more milking cow to increase their production of milk and thus improve their income. For the future they plan to request a loan in order to buy another cow and continue improving their production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Geraneos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Geraneos inicia su cuarto ciclo con 17 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. loceria, cristaleria, artesanía, pan, lácteos, quesos, cereales, comidas, verduras, leñas y también el servicio D. carpintería.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Anatolia que es casada, tiene 52 años y 8 hijos, Anatolia venD. leña en su casa, además se dedica a L. crianza D. animales en su casa como gallinas, cerdos, cuy, anteriormente tenia un pequeño restaurante el cual cerro porque se fracturo L. mano.

Mientras que Gladis es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, estudiante D. enfermería, Gladis tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en un local alquilado.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 13,300 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. quesos, cereales, lácteos, arroz, azúcar, carne, animales, comida para animales.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir una casa mas granD., ampliar su galpón, sus hijos sean profesionales, terminar su carrera y mejorar su tienda.
texts.en:
The Geranios communal bank starts its fourth cycle with 17 members. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities like: sale of tableware, glasses, crafts, bread, dairy products, cheeses, grains, prepared meals, vegetables, firewood and carpentry services. Anatolia, 52, is married and the mother of 8 children. She sells firewood from her home and also raises small farm animals like chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She used to have a small restaurant but had to close it when she fractured her hand. Gladis, on the other hand, is single, 26 years old, and has one son. She is a nursing student and runs a small grocery store in a rented locale. The members need various amounts like 300, 600, 750, and 1000 soles totaling 13,300 soles to the communal bank as a whole. Their funds will be used to buy cheeses, dairy products, rice, meat, animals, and animal feed. Among the members' dreams are: building a larger home, enlarging their farmworker's sleeping quarters, that their children become professionals, to finish their professional training, and to improve their store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses, grains, dairy products, rice, sugar, meat, animals, and animal feed.

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
Meldred H. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Meldred is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Meldred owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Meldred has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Meldred joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meldred has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Meldred is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Meldred from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chinwe

texts.en: Chinwe sells electronics to make a living. She loves this business, because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is happy with her business and family life. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. She hopes to own an electronics company in the future. She is married with 3 children and her children are doing well in their school work. Her husband is businessman and he also supports the household. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eletronics to sell

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en:
Waheed sells motor spare parts. With this business, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his family. He is happy with his business because he is the only man in this business in his community. He hopes for a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He is itching for progress in his business. 

Waheed is 47 years old and married with four children. His wife is a hairdresser and she also supports their family. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 35 años, es una madre familia muy sencilla y amorosa. Hace 11 años que vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Martín de 37 y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea dar una mejor calidad de vida.

En el poblado de “Patay” se encuentran los cultivos de Nilda, sus productos son muy buenos y es por eso que sus papas, choclos, zanahorias y alverjas,son muy bien cotizados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, ya que es ahí donde vende toda su cosecha en forma ambulante.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que siente que los meses invertidos en le cuidados de sus cultivos dan los frutos esperados. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, espera ampliar sus tierras e incrementar su producción.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Nilda con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesta a serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está bromeando con sus compañeras de grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, abono e insecticidas para mejorar productividad de su chacra.
texts.en:
Nilda is a 35-year-old humble and loving mother. She has been living with her husband Martin (age 37) and their two beloved children--to whom she wishes to give a better quality of life--in a rented home for 11 years.

Nilda's crop fields are located in the Patay settlement. Her produce is very good, which is why her potatoes, corn, carrots, and peas are very sought-after at the city's wholesale market, where she sells her crops as a street vendor.

What she likes most about her job is harvesting because she feels as if the months that she invested in caring for her crops give the eagerly awaited fruits of her labor. She has been in agriculture for 20 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is protecting her crops from any invading pests. In the future, she hopes to expand her fields and increase production.

This is Nilda's eighth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual in making her repayments and is willing to continue with this behavior. She is a very joyful communal bank member who is always joking around with her fellow group members. With the 2,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase pea seed, fertilizer and insecticide to improve her small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Leng Village Bank Group

texts.en: The eight people applying for this group loan live in Preaek Bak village in Kandal province. Mrs. Channy L. is a village bank president who has been elected to lead this group by its members. She owns a general store which serves the village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and has applied for this loan to buy more groceries to sell. Her husband, Mr. Song Meng Theng, owns a motorbike which he uses to transport fish and thereby earn extra income for the family. The couple has two children who are too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her family in Lagos State.
Sarah sells bricks and has been in this trade for many years. She also has a business selling drinks. She is requesting a loan of 140,000 NGN to buy cement in bulk for brick-making. Sarah says this will reduce cost price and her transport costs to market, and increase her profit. It will also assist her to serve her customers better and this, in turn, will help her in caring for her family's needs. Sarah says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement for brick-making

loans.name: Tsetsenmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsenmaa E. is 30, married and the mother of three children. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Tsetsenmaa operates a raw materials trading business. She sells a variety of animal products including sheepskins. Tsetsenmaa has been operating her business since 1997 and has gained valuable experience. With her earnings, she has purchased a Korean car for her family.

Her husband, Erdenebaatar, is 37 years old and a driver for the Badamlah Dul company. Two of her children attend local secondary schools. Her youngest child attends a local kindergarten. Tsetsenmaa is a great businesswoman who has been working hard to provide a better life for her family. She is a very hard-working person with a good personality. Tsetsenmaa is requesting a 2,600,000 tugrug (~1860 USD) loan to increase her business's working capital.

loans.use: To increase her business's working capital

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Cristóbal  vive en la zona Villa Bolívar, ubicada en una zona populosa de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es soltero y vive en su casa propia, la cual heredó de sus padres, y en la que viene realizando paulatinamente mejoras en la infraestructura.

Trabaja  como empleado en una empresa exportadora de muebles de madera, como técnico ensamblador.

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de unas cuantas bolsas de cemento y arena para continuar con las mejoras.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con Impro,  la  evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
. Cristóbal lives in Villa Bolívar, a crowded area of the city of El Alto. He's single and lives in his own house which he inherited from his parents; he has gradually been improving its infrastructure. He is employed as an assembly technician by a wood furniture exporting firm. He will use the funds to buy a few sacks of cement and sand to continue with the improvements. This is his 4th loan with Impro; the evaluation conducted indicates that he is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
Visitamos el Banco Comunal Los Corrales en la provincia de Manabí, localidad ubicada a pocos minutos de la ciudad  donde nació uno de los presidentes de nuestro país el viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro, en este lugar sus habitantes  se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadores  dedicados a diferentes actividades como; la venta de verduras, ebanistería y trabajos en tagua.

La señora Martha se dedica a la venta de comida tiene un restaurante en su propia casa, solo atiende los días sábados y domingos, lleva dos años con esta actividad, nos comentó que el esposos también tienen un negocio que es la venta de frutas  en un triciclo desde hace 10 años, hace su recorrido en el puerto de Manta y lo hace por sectores, cuentan con la ayuda de sus hijos que salen a vender con él, estos esposos llevan casados 40 años y sin ningún tipo de inconvenientes han sabido mantener su relación, nuestra socia Martha con este nuevo crédito podrá incrementar su negocio, comprando gallina criolla para preparar los platos típicos de la región además podrá compartir el crédito con el esposos para que surta el negocio de las frutas.
texts.en:
This is the “Los Corrales” communal bank, located in the Manabí province, a few minutes from the city where one of our country’s former presidents, Eloy Alfaro, was born. Here, the residents are hard working and dedicated to various activities, such as vegetable sales, cabinetmaking, and jewelry making. Martha sells food and has been running a restaurant out of her home for two years. It is only open on the weekends. She tells us that her husband also runs his own business, selling fruit from a three wheeled cycle, and has been doing so for ten years. He makes his run by sectors at the Manta port. They rely on their children’s help, who go out with him to make sales. They’ve been married for 40 years without any problems. Martha plans to use the money from this loan to grow her business. She will buy poultry to make dishes typical of the region. She will also share the loan with her husband, so that he can provide a greater assortment to his produce business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Beyan Group

texts.en: Samuel B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "B. Group." He is 42 years old, single and has one child who is 6 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty. For 11 years, he has been selling cosmetics such as creme, powder, and hair grease at the Old Road Market, outside Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 14,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 58,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cosmetics such as creme, powder, and hair grease. He describes himself as a trust-worthy person. His dream is to expand his business and build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics such as creme, powder, and hair grease.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Mr. Khin K. is 39 years old and is married with three children, one of whom works in construction.

Khin K. is a rattan furniture vendor. He sells furniture products that he orders from a wholesale supplier who lives near his village. His wife (shown in the photo above) stays at home to care for the children and to look after the house. She also makes rattan cupboards for a profit.

The family house is too old and small for them so Khin K. is looking for a loan to build a new wooden house to live in.

loans.use: To build a new wooden house to live in

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar de 48 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada del estero de Guayaquil), el da servicio de transporte puerta a puerta. 

Antes el trabajaba en una empresa pero como su contrato expiro lo liquidaron y tuvo que buscar otro. Al buscar y no encontrar tuvo que comenzar a trabajar como chofer, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ese ha sido su trabajo para poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijas. Trabaja desde las 06:30am hasta las 19:00pm todos los días. 

El quiere que su familia viva mejor por eso con el préstamo quiere readecuar su casa comprando cemento y bloques, en el futuro quiere tener un jardín de infantes en el patio de su casa.
texts.en:
Cesar is 48 years old and lives in the suburban zone of Guayaquil. He is in the door-to-door transportation business. He used to work for another company, but his contract expired and he was let go and had to find another job. He was not able to find other work, so he began working as a driver. Since then, this has been his livelihood with which he supports his wife and two daughters. He works from 6:30 AM to 7:00 PM every day and wants his family to have the best, so he is requesting this loan so that he can buy cement and cinder blocks so that he can refurbish his home. In the future he would like to have a playground in his patio area.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Yama De Amor 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Joelisa is the coordinator of her group, 'Yama D. Amor 1, 2, 3 & 4' ('Flame of love'). She makes her home in a simple structure with her parents and a child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work and have a better future. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy to studying and working in beauty activities.

Joelisa is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over six years, starting with her first Esperanza loan.

Joelisa plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing and underwear. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to buy a refrigerator and food and clothes for her family. She also wants to save and buy her house in the not to distant future.

This associate began with Esperanza because the program motivates people to invest in business and work hard to become successful. Esperanza came to her impoverished village and she understood that this could be her answer to achieve a better life.

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy clothing and underwear to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G. is from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 47 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Marilou raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marilou joined ASKI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional feeds for her hogs. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support her family.

About ASKI


ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers,  fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.


Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds for her hogs

loans.name: Amenodin

texts.en:
This is Amenodin P., 40, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Bodlia P.. They are blessed in their marriage with good health and strong physiques which enable them to work hard for their future together. They have two high-school aged children.

Amenodin operates a ready-to-wear clothing store where he also sells original DVDs, and cellular phone accessories. He mainly offers children’s clothing, summer shorts (which are very popular in tropical Philippines), statement shirts, and other basic everyday wear. This clothing is made from sheer cotton fabrics, which are all suited to the hot and humid climate. Most customers only buy made-to-order clothing when it is really necessary, as it is more expensive. Amenodin’s customers are his immediate community and neighbors.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more and varied cellular phone accessories to replenish and expand his current business inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 
 
Amenodin dreams of being able to have a comfortable and well-off future with his family. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more and varied cellular phone accessories

loans.name: Elvira Guadalupe

texts.es: Elvira Guadalupe C. H. se dedica a la venta de donas y tamales que ella misma prepara desde hace 2 años, esta es de manera que ayuda con los gastos a su esposo que es pensionado. La señora requiere de un préstamo para seguir surtiendo su venta y así seguir generando mas ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Elvira Guadalupe C. H. makes a living selling donuts and tamales that she prepares herself and has been doing for the past 2 years. This is how she helps her husband, who is on pension, with the expenses. She needs a loan to continue supplying her sales and this way, generating more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 29-year-old married woman who is the mother of four children. She has been the owner of a small mini market since 2000. She helps with her family's income while at the same time her husband works in agriculture. Her clients are loyA. because she serves them in a very polite way.  She hopes to expand her business into a bigger supermarket. Sabah is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy a car for her husband to help him transport his seeds and machines from one place to another.

loans.use: To buy a car for her husband's work

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a housewife, but in order to financially support her family, she also weaves carpets on order. She lives in a three-room brick house with her family in Kasur, which is a small city famous for its leather industry in Punjab, Pakistan. 

She is the mother of seven sons. She couldn’t provide an education to her elder sons, but now they have started doing work and through their financial support, she has been able to enroll her three younger sons in school. She wishes that they could complete their education and make their future bright and never suffer the same problems their elder brothers have faced in their lives. 

Her husband, G. N., is involved in selling bakery items. He collects orders from different bakeries and supplies them the baked items such as fruit cakes, bread, biscuits, etc., to earn an income for the family. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. He will buy bakery items in bulk with the loan and fulfill his larger orders on time.

loans.use: To buy bakery items in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Inocensia

texts.en:
Inocensia B. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Inocensia is married and has three adult children.

Inocensia owns a business venture in which she provides boarding house (lodging house for students) services in the local community. Inocensia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Inocensia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Inocensia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Inocensia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Inocensia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to continue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Naftarly

texts.en:
Naftarly is 38 years old, married and the father of four.  He has been engaged in the business of quarrying for eight years.  This business has helped him to educate his four children.

He is a hardworking man who dreams of starting another business, which is selling bananas.  As a result, he has requested 30,000 KES to buy bananas.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to passengers and drops them at their designated places. His rickshaw is creating a problem nowadays which is affecting his work and income. He will utilize the loan in repairing it so, he can continue his work and provide his services to the passengers.
 
Naseem is a mid-wife. She adopted this profession a few years ago to financially assist her husband. In Pakistan midwifery is a profitable profession because many poor people can’t afford hospital fees and they prefer to approach midwives.  In her spare time she also does embroidery work for her neighboring clients to earn extra income for her family. 

She has given birth to 5 daughters who are enrolled in school and getting their education. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has  built up a good credit history and never missed any meeting.  

She comes from Arifwala, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in an area called Muhallah Eid Gah which is a small residential area of the city.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo V. is from the village of Cabisera 27, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 53 years old. Camilo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests corn to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty-five years and earns approximately $230 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Camilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Camilo is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his 6th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
Juana María tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el centro poblado Lagunas, una comunidad pequeña situada a la orilla del mar. Pertenece al distrito del mismo nombre y se encuentra situada a más D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace más D. dos años a la comercialización D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos D. uso diario que usualmente serían difíciles D. conseguir debido a su ubicación retirada D. otros núcleos urbanos. Este factor ha hecho que su negocio cuente con muy buena acogida, ello hace que siempre se esfuerce más por brindar a sus clientes una buena atención y productos D. calidad. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Juana desea adquirir más mercadería para poder ampliar su negocio y sus ventas, D. este modo planea aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juana María is 47 years old, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the center of the Lagunas town, a small community located on the seashore. It belongs to the district of the same name and is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Juana for more than two years has sold basic household goods and groceries in a small grocery store in her home. There she offers her neighbors different products for daily use that are usually difficult to find due to their distance from other cities. This has maD. her business very well received and she always works hard to bring her customers the best care and quality products. The income that she receives from her job she uses to help her husband take care of the family finances.

Juana wishes to have more merchandize to be able to expand her business and sales and she wants to increase income to help her family get ahead. To meet her goal she has sought Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) to help for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy more merchandize to expand her business and sales.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
