Rosario G. is from the village of Lugdungan. She is 55 years old, married and has six adult children. Rosario operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, primarily planting rice in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her rice. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosario from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman who lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 businesses: a sari-sari (general) store, a sugarcane plantation and a tricycle transport business. Her husband, Jeremiah P., 47 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have four children, aged 12 to 20 years old.

Lucia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Lucia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for the general store in order to save up for the business' future expansion. Lucia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes B. D. Q. resiD. en la urbanización monte blanco D.  D. Soyapango en el departamento D. San Salvador. Con  40 años D. edad, resiD. junto a su esposo y dos hijos pequeños. Para poder salir adelante, ella inició a las afueras D. su casa una pequeña venta D. frutas y verduras, la cual ha ido creciendo con mucho esfuerzo. Mercedes solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda mejorar aún más su negocio comprando mayor cantidad D. frutas D. estación y D. verduras. La mayor ilusión D. Mercedes es el D. salir adelante y D. esta forma vivir mejor junto a su familia, la cual la necesita en gran manera.
texts.en:
Mercedes B. D. Q. resides in the urban neighborhood of Monte Blanco in Soyapango, Department of San Salvador. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two young children. In order to get ahead, Mercedes opened a small fruit and vegetable stand outsiD. of her home. Her business has grown through much effort.

Mercedes is requesting a loan so that she can improve her business by purchasing a large quantity of seasonal fruits and vegetables. Her greatest wish is to move forward and be able to have a better life with her family, something she truly needs.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Dossi  Abla

texts.fr: Madame Abla est mariée et a  2 enfants. Elle habite quartier  Kpogan.  Pour  participer  au    menage,  elle  fait la  vente  de pagnes  et  casseroles.  Elle a  commencé  en  2006 et s’approvisionne en  gros  au  grand  marché de  Lomé.  Ensuite,  elle  redistribue  en détail.   Elle  sollicite de Wages  un  prêt  pour  se  réapprovisionner  et satisfaire   plus  de  clients.
texts.en: Mrs. Abla is married with two children. She lives in the Kpogan neighborhood. In order to help with the household responsibilities, she started selling pots and pagnes (colorful print cloth) in 2006. She gets her merchandise wholesale at the grand market of Lomé for resale at retail. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to replenish her stocks and satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy pots and pagnes for resale

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha Y., 48 years old, is a widowed woman who owns a small house and a grocery shop, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredients, sweets, shampoo and soft drinks. Ha Y. retails her inventory to people who are passing by and who are also her neighbors living near her house. She has been running a grocery investment for a long time and earns an average of $5 a day. She also relies on her son’s business. He normally needs to reserve a section of the pond where small fish grow, and he also catches them to sell when the fish are mature. Recently, he has needed more money to supply his business, so Ha Y. has requested a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To assistst in her son's fish-feeding business.

loans.name: Harris

texts.en:
Harris D. S. T. is 33 years old, married and a father of four children. They live in Endebess in the outskirts of Kitale town. He does horticulture farming and is also in the transportation business in the same area. Harris has been in this business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of about $950.

This will be Harris' first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to repair his vehicle so that he can offer better services to his customers. He will also buy pesticides and insecticides for use on his farm. 

In future he hopes to save and buy another piece of land where he can expand his horticulture business.

loans.use: to repair his motor vehicle, and to buy pesticides and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ivania Del Socorro tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores a su cargo. Ella tiene la actividad económica de venta de productos lácteos ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 7 años, ella empezó vendiendo con esfuerzo propio por lo que siempre ha demostrado que ha salido adelante a pesar de todos los problemas que ha enfrentado. Sin embargo con el tiempo logro establecer su actividad, ya que ella ha mejorado poco a poco su actividad. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima como queso, cuajada, mantequilla y crema. Por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora y que es famosa por la venta de sus productos. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Ivania Del Socorro is 33 years old, married, and has two young children under her care. She has a business selling dairy products from her home. Ivania started this business seven years ago. She started selling on her own because she always demonstrated the desire to get ahead despite the problems she has faced. Nonetheless, she was able to establish her business and continues to improve it little by little.

Her loan will be invested in large quantities of cheese, curds, butter, and cream. Ivania is an extremely hardworking woman who is known for selling her products. She dreams of improving her home.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of cheese, curds, butter, and cream.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora R. is from the village of Minlagas, San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Leonora is married and has three school-age children. Leonora owns and operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables, like eggplants and string beans. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for newly planted crops. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for newly planted crops

location.town: Minlagas, San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: La señora Santusa es agricultora y produce hortalizas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semillas de zanahorias, nabos, remolachas, etc., para continuar con su negocio de producción de hortalizas de donde genera sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la población de Río Abajo en el departamento de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que canalizamos su crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Santusa is a farmer and grows vegetables.  She will use the loan to buy seeds for carrots, turnips, beets, etc. for her vegetable business which is how she gets income.  She lives in her own house in the town of Rio Abajo in La Paz department.  She is married and has two children.  This is the second time she has channeled a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy turnip, beet and other seeds for her business of growing and selling vegetables.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine  is from the village of Ubay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 42 years old. Josephine is married. 

To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a general store. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Josephine is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um is a businesswoman who earns a living by planting crops as well as selling some fresh fish and other items in her community. She can make around $2.7 a day to cover the whole family’s needs. Her husband works as a policeman and he has a set salary every month. They are blessed with three children who study in the local school in the Baray district of Kompomg Tom Province. 

She has had great success growing crops and she is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Um doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So she is looking for a loan to use toward purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a plowing machine and seeds for planting.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a plowing machine and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Bejan

texts.ru: Бежан проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена занимается торговлей парфюмерии. Сам Бежан имеет среднее образование. Он предоставляет услугу. В основном он занимается ремонтом мобильных телефонов. Этим видом деятельности Бежан занимается 8 лет. Целью кредита является приобретение необходимых инструментов для ремонта мобильных телефонов.
texts.en: Bejan lives in the city of Kulob. He is 31 years old, married, and has three children. His wife sells perfume. Bejan has a secondary education. He provides a service. Basically, he is repairs mobile phones. He has been doing this work for eight years.  He is taking out a loan to buy tools necessary to repair mobile phones.

loans.use: to buy tools necessary to repair mobile phones.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Victoria has a shop that sells candies, biscuits, snacks, and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, and breads.

Victoria has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and breads.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a budding 33-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children who are in school. She has been operating a slaughterhouse for the last three years in order to meet the needs of her family. She wants, in the next five years, to have expanded her business and in the future open up more slaughterhouses.

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase slaughtering equipment. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has now become more focused on her business.

loans.use: to purchase slaughtering equipment

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is from the village of Toki, South Georgia.She is 37 years old and lives in the village with her two sons (18 and 13 years old). Both of them go to school. 

Leila is leading the agricultural business for the family. In particular, they have four milk cows and sell approximately 80 kg of cheese in Akhaltsikhe (a nearby town). In addition, she is busy with potato growing. She sells the harvested potatoes in Akhaltsikhe as well. The total monthly income of the family is approximately 350 Laris. 

Leila requests a loan to purchase calves. After six months, she will sell the grown calves for a higher price and get additional income. Starting in September, a significant part of the family finances will go to financing the education of Leila’s elder son, as he is entering high-school this year.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia nacida en Santa Cruz, casada con el señor Ángel, tiene 58 años D. edad, La señora se dedica a la realización y decoración D. Eventos Sociales como matrimonios. Fiestas D. cumpleaños te piñatas y todo tipo D. eventos sociales, se dedica a esta actividad hace varios años. Tiene 4 hijos ya mayores D. edad todos independientes. El crédito otorgado es para la compra D. tela para la decoración D. mesas y sillas, se siente muy feliz por el apoyo brindado ya que D. esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia was born in Santa Cruz and is married to Sr. Ángel. She is 58 years old and operates a business that involves making and providing decorations for social events such as weddings, birthday and piñata parties, and other occasions. Virginia has been in business for several years. She has four children who are already grown and independent.

The loan will be used to buy fabric for decorating tables and chairs. She is very happy with the support that has been provided because it will help her improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fabric for decorating tables and chairs.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es una mujer trabajadora tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada y tiene hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Nos platica que ella no estudio por que sus padres no tenían la solvencia económica para mandarla a la escuela y también por que a ella no le gustaba estudiar, dice que desde muy pequeña su mama le enseño hacer tortillas a mano para que se ganara la vida haciendo algo y ya estando casada para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ella puso un puesto de tortillas y sopesitos (comida mexicana) para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella tiene con su negocio hace un poco mas de 3 años, dice que a diario vende sus tortillas fuera de su casa vende dos veces al día a las 8 de la mañana y a las 12 del día para la hora de la comida, dice que a diario ella se levanta muy temprano a poner su nixtamal para después salir a moler y hacer la  masa con lo que hace las tortillas. Aurora esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, y para hacer los sopesitos frijoles ya que van rellenos. La meta que tiene Aurora es mas adelante poner otro puesto de venta de tortillas y por las noches vender antojitos mexicanos fuera de su casa.
texts.en:
Aurora, 52, is a hardworking woman.  She’s married and has children that no longer depend on her.  She tells us that she never went to school because her parents did not have economic solvency to send her to school and also because she did not like to study.  She says that ever since she was a little girl her mother taught her how to make hand-made tortillas so that she’d have a way to earn a living and once married be able to help her husband with household expenses. 

She set up a stand selling tortillas and sopesitos (Mexican food) to have a better quality of life.  She’s had the business for a little over three years.  She says that she sells tortillas daily outside her house twice a day, at 8am and at noon for lunch.  She says that she gets up very early every day to prepare the nixtamal (corn soaked in lime water) so that later she can go grind it and make the tortilla dough.

Aurora is asking for the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder and beans to make the sopesitos because they are stuffed.  Aurora’s goal for later on is to open another tortilla stand and to sell Mexican fast food snacks outside her house in the evenings.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime powder and beans.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora Irene tiene la edad de 25 años, estudio hasta 3 de primaria, se encuentra casada, tene 3 hijos los cuales estudian, ella y su familia vive en una  comunidad la cual se caracteriza por estar en una zona cañera.

Ella nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de 3 años inicio a trabajar pues esto permite ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia es por eso que decidio vender bolsas de mano y ropa para dama y caballero y asi obtener dinero extra.

La señora Irene realiza sus ventas ofreciendo a sus amigas y vecinas sus productos, pero tambien sale casa por casa en toda sus comunidad para que asi vender sus bolsas de mano y ropa para dama y caballero, dice que gracias a dios le va bien y que obtiene un poco de ganancias.

Ella necesita este credito para comprar bolsas de mano, ropa interior para dama y caballero, faldas, blusas, camisas, pantalones y vestidos para posteriormente venderlos.

La señora Irene espera que con esta inversion su negocio cresca para asi ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familia.
texts.en:
Irene is 25 years old and studied until the third grade of elementary school. She is married and has 3 children who are all in school. She and her family live in a community characterized as being in a sugar cane area.

She informs us that a little over 3 years ago, she began to work so that she could help her husband and family get ahead. That is why she decided to sell hand bags and clothing for women and men and obtain some extra money. 

Irene sells her products to her friends and neighbors, but she also goes door to door throughout her community, selling her handbags and women's and men's clothing and says that it has been going well, thank God, and that she has earned a little income.

Irene needs this loan to buy hand bags, women's and men’s underwear, skirts, blouses, shirts, pants and dresses to later sell. She hopes that with this investment her business will grow, thereby providing a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to sell clothing.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has been practicing livestock farming for the last 10 years in Limuru town. He is 37 years old married to Dorcas. They have two schooling children.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET client. He repaid his other loans well and in good time. He intends to use this loan to buy a cow and expand the agriculture sector.

In the future he hopes to become a successful farmer and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a cow and expand the agriculture sector.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new season products to sell

loans.name: Bernarda Beatriz

texts.es:
Bernarda D. 55 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Bernarda tiene como actividad laboral la confección y venta D. prendas D. vestir, desD. hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela, se a hecho conocida por el buen trabajo que realiza y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias D. su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla D. 1000 para comprar material como telas, hilos y accesorios para realizar sus prendas D. vestir, así pueD. seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, lo que le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.  Bernarda con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio y a su familia adelante, con la intensión D. superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 55 years old and she lives in a house of her own together with her family. The house is equipped with all the basic services and it is located in an urban region in the district of TambogranD., belonging to the department of Piura. This region is known for its agricultural, farming and artisan activities.

Bernarda's business activity is the production and sale of articles of clothing. She has had her business for several years in her house. She has her own clientele and she has gotten herself known for the good work that she produces. She also works by taking orders. The competition in the field is not very much. With the income that she obtains she will be able to cover the daily necessities of the household.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) through Capital Semilla D. 1000 to purchase materials such as fabrics, threads, and accessories to make articles of clothing. This way she will be able to continue providing a good service and filling the orders that her clients have placed. In turn, this will permit her to earn greater profits to improve the quality of her family's life. Bernarda has known how to move her business forward through a great deal of effort and a lot of work. Her intention is to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabrics, threads, and accessories to produce articles of clothing.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 34 years old and married to Robert. Together, they have two children. For the past 11 years, Teresa has sold household items such as cups, basins, and buckets. 

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy more basins, cups, and plates, along with other merchandise to sell. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. Teresa will use the anticipated profit from her loan to reinvest in her business. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy basins, cups, plates

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Gloria has a retail shop that sells homemade sausage called longganisa, chorizo and dressed chicken. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Gloria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Oyshamo

texts.ru: Ойшамо проживает городе Кургантюбе. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама она занимается скотоводством.  В основном она откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Oyshamo lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 42 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband is in Russia. She herself works in animal husbandry. She primarily fattens and sells cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: purchase calves

loans.name: Diana Margarita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Diana, tiene 25 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 5, 4 y 2 años de edad, el  mayor estudian en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el mismo que tiene un puesto en el mercado de Tarqui en la  ciudad de Manta en el que vende frutas y verduras. Trabaja de martes a domingo. Su esposo se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para sus clientes ya que las personas lo prefieren porque siempre vende un buen producto, tiene este negocio 3 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos puede financiarse sin tener que pagar altos intereses.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en el grupo.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos" ["United Women of Los Bajos"] communal bank meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known both for its cultural riches and for handicrafts such as Panama hats, which are known both within the country and abroad.

This is where we met Ms. Diana. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage. They are 5, 4, and 2 years old and the oldest attends pre-school. Her husband is a merchant.

Diana is taking out this loan for her husband's business. He has a stand in the Tarqui market in the city of Manta, where he sells fruits and vegetables. He works from Monday to Sunday. Diana's husband leaves at dawn for the wholesale market in order to buy the best products for his customers. People prefer him because he always sells good produce. He has had this business for three years and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables. Diana has been in the communal bank since it's initiation and she likes it because she can get loans without paying high interest rates.

Her dream is to continue moving forward with the group.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is from the village of Kolagi, in the Kakheti Region. He is 64 years old and lives with his wife, Nina. Giorgi and Nina earn their living through agricultural activities. They own a 2-hectare peach orchard and a 0.14-hectare vineyard. Giorgi sells his grapes and peaches locally. The family's total average monthly income is 700 laris.

Giorgi has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for the peach orchard. After proper fertilization, Giorgi can count on a good harvest next year, which will bring additional income to the family. He will also use part of the loan to pay his seasonal workforce.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay his workforce.

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
Emalyn is a 32-year-old who has two children and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Emalyn is engaged in a fishing business venture, selling seafood products including fish, crabs, and shrimp in the local community. She has been in this business for 2 years and uses a  motorcycle to sell her fish from place to place or house to house. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP through this work.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Recently, Emalyn joined GDMPC to gain financial support and assistance for her business, which she hopes to improve and expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a business lady who runs a clinic. She previously serviced a loan of 40,000 KES, which she used to decorate her clinic. Since then, she has increased her clientele. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has also been trained on business management skills that have helped her to improve the business.

Everlyne is requesting another loan of 60,000 KES to buy a microscope and medicine.

loans.use: to buy a microscope and medicine.

loans.name: Heisen

texts.es: Heisen, de 30 años de edad, es un hombre empeñoso y trabajador, además de tener muchas gana de salir adelante, convive con Jessica quien le ayuda en la atención de su negocio familiar. Juntos habitan en su propia casa en compañía de su hijo de 4 años. La actividad que realiza es el alquiler de videojuegos para eso cuenta con 04 equipos instalados en su propia casa donde tiene un ambiente con mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes. Es así que sus cabina son alquiladas a vecinos y  personas que solicitan el servicio, asimismo nos comenta que éste negocio lo aprendió hace 5 años de sus hermanos que también ejercen el mismo rubro. Con el tiempo logró ahorrar y éste capital comenzó con su propio negocio y ahora atiende a lada de su pareja. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar además de tener una ocupación, viendo la rentabilidad que le deja su negocio pues aprendió de sus hermanos. Ahora lo que más prioriza es terminar sus estudios técnicos en construcción civil y constituir una oficina de asesoría de estudios de planos, para eso desea comenzar con una computadora. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente contento con el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de contar con el apoyo de su banco comunal, donde se siente cómodo y en confianza. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de una computadora con los planes de brindar servicio de asesoria en construcción civil.
texts.en:
Heisen, aged 30, is a hard-working man who wants to progress. He lives in a common-law marriage with Jessica who helps him attending the family business. They live in their own house with their four-year-old son. Heisen's activity consists in renting video games. He has installed four play stations at home, where he has a room with tables and chairs for the convenience of his customers. The booths are rented to neighbors and other people requesting his services. He told us that he learned this activity five years ago from his brothers who are also active in this business. Eventually he managed to save some money and used it as start capital for his own business, and now he and his partner attend it together. He likes his business because it gives him an income to cover household expenses and keeps him busy.

Now his highest priority is to finish his education as a civil engineer and open a consulting business to draw up design plans. He wants to start with the purchase of a computer. To realize his plans and get the needed financial resources, he came to the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma and applied for his second loan. He likes his communal bank, because in addition to their support he feels at ease and confident when dealing with them. He will invest the 1200 new soles of the loan in a computer with the goal to provide consultancy services in civil engineering.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Kadiatu L.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the schools in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone.  This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 5,400,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay SMT/Kiva lenders, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments and pays SMT/Kiva lender on their behalf.

Kadiatu is the leader of this group. The forty-year-old was born in Kenema, is married and has two children who are in college.  Kadiatu has served in the teaching profession for more than twenty years now. She has requested for this loan in order to educate her children. She will use the loan to pay college fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her children

loans.name: Andro Bazar Shg Group

texts.en:
Mala, 31 years old and the featured borrower of the 'Andro Bazar SHG' on the extreme left with hand raised, did her best with the previous loan she received from WSDS. The loan helped her a lot in her brewery business, i.e., making  local wine, by enabling her to buy the raw materials like rice, yeast, charcoal, firewood and other necessities required from time to time. She also raised pigs which she feeds with the rice remaining after brewing. 

Mala and the other group members have successfully completed their first and second loan cycles. The loans helped Mala a lot in maintaining her family and covering household needs but she cannot expand much further to get more profits and savings as the price of commodities rises rapidly from time to time.  

Mala and the other group members are now asking for loan from KIVA. With the loan from KIVA, Mala expects to buy more rice, yeast, charcoal, firewood and piglets in larger quantity for expansion of her business to earn more profit, put aside savings and also make it easier for them in the repayment of the loan. Mala and the other group members expect a long association with WSDS and KIVA which they believe is an opportunity to bring a change in their lives.

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, piggery and brewery.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of rice, firewood and yeast in abundance to brew wine and make more income.

loans.name: Febrianti

texts.en: Febrianti Kurni is a student in the national vocational high school in Cipanas.  Her mother is a single parent because her father died about six years ago. To handle the family economy and costs, she sells food in her school. Thank God for the loan from Kiva and KOMIDA. Now she can continue her education.

loans.use: to pay half of her school costs

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is a farmer and a good salesperson from Kitale, Kenya. He raises livestock and practices crop farming for a living. Besides his core business, he generates additional income by playing a middleman in the cereal trade industry. His job is to buy cereal produce from local farmers and sell to his network of buyers at a margin.

Given that Noah can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, he prefers to stock large volumes of cereals. He is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers which, using his understanding of the market conditions and prices, he will later sell at a higher price.

Income from this investment will help Noah generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Efraín

texts.en: Efraín has been repairing cicycles for twenty years. He works every day from 7am until 11pm helping customers fix their bikes, which for many people are their only mode of transportation. He is applying for this credit so that he can purchase bike components like sprockets, chains, and gears, but he is also planning on using the money to improve the outward appearance of his shop. Efrain is 66 years old, and he lives alone. His wife passed away several years ago, and his four children are grown up. They visit frequently and help him run the shop from time to time. His wish is to continue serving more and more customers, helping them with their bike needs

loans.use: He is applying for this credit so that he can purchase bike components like sprockets, chains, and gears, but he is also planning on using the money to improve the outward appearance of his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary intends to buy 3 sacks of potatoes, 1 box of tomatoes and 1 sack of kales and spinach

loans.name: Ruth Khalayi

texts.en: Ruth is married with eight children all in primary school.  She has not undertaken any formal training.  She started her business in 2002, which includes selling clothes at different marketplaces.  With a loan from PEMCI, Ruth intends to increase her stock of clothes. Through her business, she has been able to bring affordable clothes to the locals, support her family, and improve their general welfare.

loans.use: To increase her clothes business

loans.name: Khong

texts.en:
It is great to visit Mrs. Khong T. Y.'s farm in a hot and sticky summer afternoon. There you can feel pleasant thanks to green banana trees, fresh green tea cups and above all, thanks to the hospitality and friendliness of the mistress. That is my feeling every time I drop in her farm. So now let me tell you the story about this likable woman.

She is 40 years old and her husband, Mr. NguY. Van Co, is same age. They have a son and a daughter who are both in high school. They have contracted for this farm since January 2007 and have invested a lot of money in it. Every day she and her husband look after 800 ducks including egg-laying ducks and ducks for food, 25 pigs and a fish pond and a rice field of one hectare. However, she is still full of energy and plans. So she wants to borrow $1,200.00 to build a biogas plant ($430.00) to keep the environment clean and make the most of livestock manure. She will also use the loan to buy 25 breeding pigs and 800 chickens and ducks. As for payment, she is very confident and proud because she gets $6.5 per day from selling eggs, not to mention regular incomes from other livestocks. She says she doesn't fear hardship, she just dreams of having enough money to send her children to university.

loans.use: She wants to build a biogas plant and buy pigs, chickens and ducks for her livestock raising business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria N. of Aleisa, 28, and mother of 3 children is another success story of the SPBD programme. Maria’s small business venture is her vegetable garden and it is the only source of income for the family. Both Maria and her husband work in the vegetable garden and they also own a stall at the Fugalei Food Market where they sell their produce.

loans.use: For gardening supplies

loans.name: Tomat Kebonsari Group

texts.id:
This group with members I Wayan Mudiana, I Wayan Moder, I Nyoman Lisig, I Nyoman Sueda dan I Nyoman Cindra is tomato farmers. To meet each family’s needs, they use the fields they own to grow tomato, which can be harvest in 3 months. Although the tomato price is unstable, they believe that their efforts will yield satisfying crop. All 5 members in this tomato group are hopeful the funding will help in their farming effort, thus they are grateful that this aid will support the purchase of all essential like seeds, manure, and payment of care expenses for the growing period.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok yang beranggotakan I Wayan Mudiana, I Wayan Moder, I Nyoman Lisig, I Nyoman Sueda dan I Nyoman Cindra adalah sebagai petani tomat. Untuk mencukupi setiap kebutuhan keluarga mereka masing-masing lahan yang mereka punyai ditanami tomat yang masa panennya hanya tiga bulan. Meskipun harga tomat tidak stabil tetapi mereka selalu percaya bahwa segala sesuatu apabila dilakukan dengan sungguh-sungguh maka akan mendatangkan hasil yang memuaskan. Kelima anggota dalam kelompok tomat ini sangat mengharapkan bantuan permodalan untuk menunjang akan usaha pertanian mereka, untuk itu mereka sangat bersukacita atas bantuan yang diberikan untuk membeli segala keperluan seperti bibit, pupuk, dan biaya perawatan selama proses penanaman berlangsung.

loans.use: Purchase all essentials like seeds, manure and pay for care expenses (Membeli segala keperluan seperti bibit, pupuk, dan biaya perawatan)

loans.name: Marnia Fermina

texts.es:
Sra. Marnia Fermina B. is 31 years old, and is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is the single mother of 4 children who attend primary and secondary school. Sra. B. has 5 years of experience as owner of a meat market where she sells pork and beef. Her clients are restaurant owners and heads of households. It is notable that this month a significant amount of pork is consumed for the Christmas holidays. For this reason, Sra. B. needs to purchase 400 pounds of pork at a cost of $0.75 per pound. This investment should be enough to cover the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Marnia Fermina B. tiene 31 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, es madre soltera de 4 hijos que estudian en la primaria y secundaria. La Sra. B. tiene 5 años de experiencia, es propietaria de una carnicería donde vende carne de cerdo y de res. Sus clientes son los dueños de comedores y padres de familia. Cabe mencionar que en este mes se consume bastante la carne de cerdo para las fiestas navideñas por esa razón la Sra. B. necesita comprar 400 libras de carne de cerdo que cuesta $ 0.75 centavo dólar la libra, con esta inversión podrá abastecer la demanda de los dueños de comedores y de los padres de familia.

loans.use: Purchase of 400 lbs. of pork

loans.name: Kamuli C1 (B) Group

texts.en: Jane is 30 years old and married with four children. She runs a tailoring business. She would  use the extra profits to start a tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.en: Zulkhumor A. has been a MicroInvest client since 2005. She applies to MicroInvest for business development loans that help her to support and expand her business. She is engaged in the commercial services industry where she makes Xerox copies and computer service presentations for her customers. Now Mrs. A. seeks a loan of 3700 TJS ($1,075) to purchase additional office equipment (specifically, the new model computer and a scanner).

loans.use: To purchase new office equipment (computer and scanner)

loans.name: Thi Vu

texts.vi:
Mrs Vụ is 38 years old. She is a nurse, she has clinic at home. She has 2 children who are attending school. Her husband, Lê Thanh Bình, works in construction. She applies for a loan to buy conic hats (traditional vietnamese hat, conic shape) to resell. She has never borrowed money before. She applied to BinhMinh cdc (SEDA) because she likes weekly payment arrangement

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vụ, 38 tuổi, là y tá khám chữa bệnh bán thuốc tại nhà. Chị đã có hai con đang còn đi học. Chồng chị Lê Thanh Bình là thợ xây. Chị tham gia vay 2006000 đồng để lấy vốn mua nón rồi để bán, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nay chị tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị thích hình thức trả góp hàng tuần.

loans.use: buy conic hats to resell

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is a 50 year old woman who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs.

Hadia sells clothes. She needs a loan to buy new merchandise so she can sustain and develop her business. Hadia is striving to provide for herself and to make ends meet.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Korn Kheav Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Korn K. is the leader of a four-woman group in Tie Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small restaurant in the local village and has asked for a loan to purchase more rice to cook for her customers. Mrs. Korn K. is a 56-year-old widow, mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. She has previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy the ingredients to make Khmer cakes to sell in the village.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for a restaurant

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate E. is 40 years old, married with two children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling groceries. She studied this business for 12 months before opening her store in 1999. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more supplies to sell. She has been a LAPO client for six years.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nnaecheta

texts.en: Nnaecheta C. C. is 33 years old and married with a child. He lives in Benin City with his family. C. sells timber. He learned this business in 9 years, and he started his own timber business in 2000. He is a LAPO client. He is requesting the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more timber for sale.

loans.use: To buy more timber for sale

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mr. Em S., 53, has been a house construction worker since 1995, earning approximately $2 per day, while his wife is a farmer who earns about $1.50 per day. They have two married and two single children, one a bricklayer and another a garment worker. Mr. S. is now requesting a loan of $250 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers for his wife’s farming business.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for his wife's farming business

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y tiene 47 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa, y tiene dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad,  que están cursando la primaria. Don Víctor tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación y tiene dos años de experiencia en ventas, inició con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante. La solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo para la pulpería, la va a surtir con productos de belleza, para así ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Espera tener la capacidad para seguir prestando y así invertir en su negocio, para poder fortalecerlo y hacerlo más próspero.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the region of Laureles Sur. He is married and is 47 years old. His wife is a homemaker and they have two children aged 3 and 5 years old and they are in primary school. Victor runs a grocery store from his house and he has two years experience in sales. He started out with his own capital and with a great deal of hard work he has seen success.

He is requesting this loan so that he can invest the capital in his grocery store. He wants to stock the shelves with beauty products, just to offer more variety to his clients. He forsees his capacity to keep managing his loans and thereby continue investing in his business, to better stabilize it and to improve it.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es:
María tiene 60 años. Ella tiene un depósito de cerveza en su casa desde hace 2 años. Además, por las noches, ella sale a vender comida en un puesto ambulante. Anteriormente, ella administraba un taller de cerrajería, sin embargo, por los bajos ingresos que le producía tuvo que cerrarlo. 
El último crédito que ella recibió le ayudo a comprar las bebidas que ella vende. 
Sin embargo, ella cuenta que ahora necesita un nuevo crédito para comprar una congeladora, ya que para el negocio que ella tiene, es indispensable.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old. She has been selling beer from her house for the last two years and she also sells food in the evenings, door to door. Prior to this she use to manage a locksmith shop but the income from this business was just too small and she had to close it up.

The previous loan she received helped her purchase the drinks that she now sells. But she still requires another loan to purchase a fridge, a very important appliance for her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a fridge for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa has owned a genge in Zanzibar for one year. A genge is a stand selling fruits and vegetables. It can be as small as a plank of wood on a quiet side street or as large as a well-stocked shop in a bustling city market. Hawa currently earns approximately $160 in profit each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more potatoes, onions, and other vegetables for her genge.

Hawa is 24 years old, married, and has one 3-month-old child.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for her stand.

loans.name: Zareena M.nazir Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji, the wife of M. Ahmad, resides in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat. 

She is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her elder son has a business selling leather. The son next to him is an employee of private company and earns a monthly wage. Her younger son is in the 2nd standard grade. Her elder daughter completed her education throught the 10th standard grade and has started working in a hospital. The next daughter is in the 10th standard grade. Her next daughter is in the 9th standard grade and her youngest daughter is in the 4th standard grade. 

Zareena baji stays at home and sews clothes on order. She collects orders from her neighborhood. She charges $2 to 3$ per suit. Her husband has a business selling stamp paper. He collects the stamp papers from court and sells them to customers who require them. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. 

Zareena baji successfully has repaid two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more leather to expand her elder son’s leather-selling business. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Zubaida Khatoon baji and Najma baji each want a loan to buy goats for their meat-selling business. Kishawar baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her salon. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather to resell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M., a 45-year-old mother from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, is a rice farmer. Her husband helps her till a small parcel of land just to have enough food to share with her children. She has spent her life growing rice and other crops. She never loses hope that someday she and her family will have a better life.  

Agnes would like a loan of $175 to purchase sacks of certified seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of her harvest. She also is willing to look for some other possible work to augment their income.

"Joining the CEVI credit program is the best thing that has ever happened to me, ” she said. “Since then, I have access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI offers to their clients,” she added.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of certified seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is forty-three years old. She is married and has four children. Currently, two of her children have completed high school while the rest are in the basic school. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates cash crops such as cocoa and some vegetable crops.

Doris says her husband is trying his best to provide for the family but his income is not enough to provide for the entire family and moreover, to pay the children’s school fees. As a result, it is necessary for her to work to help her husband support the family.

Doris is a second-hand textile dealer. She deals mostly in women's dresses and bedspreads. She buys from wholesalers in Kumasi and hawks her wares to houses in her community. She also sells on a table top in front of her house and in the local market square. She wants a loan to buy textiles in large bales so that she can trek to other towns to do business. She desires to help her husband pay for their children to get to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles for re-sale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Sabina M. from Mwanza. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 15 and 28 years old. Sabina has been running a general store since 2006. Her business is to sell soft drinks such as soda, biscuits, books and rulers. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Sabina currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 300 USD in order to buy soda, juice, beer and biscuits. In the future, she plans to open another business. Victoria thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy soda, juice, beer and biscuits

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia solo cuenta con el apoyo de los prestamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace un año; sin embargo, su negocio tiene ya veinte años en funcionamiento. Empezó vendiendo como ambulante cuando aún el mercado donde trabaja ahora no existía. Luego de cinco años se mudó y montó un puesto improvisado en el mismo lugar donde, tiempo después, se ubicaría el mercado que hoy en día acoge a muchas más trabajadoras como Julia.
Con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos, ya que el negocio de verduras ha bajado, quisiera conseguirse una carreta para poder vender paralelamente golosinas y bebidas en el mercado.
Por otro lado, su esposo se desenvuelve en cualquier trabajo cuando lo requieren, aunque se especializa en el rubro de construcción. Entre ambos cubren los gastos de su casa y de la educación de sus cuatro menores hijos.
texts.en:
Julia has only been involved with EDAPROSPO for one year, but has had her business for twenty. She began working as a street vendor when the market where she now works did not exist. After five years, she moved and started a shop in the same location where the market now stands and where there are many more workers like Julia.

In order to increase her income, since profits from her business selling vegetables have decreased, she would like to get a cart from which to sell sweets and drinks in the market. In addition, her husband takes on any work he can find, although he specializes in construction. Between the two of them, they cover their household expenses and the cost of educating their four young children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tiles to finish off her home.

loans.name: Bivian

texts.es: Bivian tiene 37 años, vive con su hijo de 7 años en su propia casa. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de carne de cuyes, tiene de su propio criadero y atiende los pedidos que le soliciten, que generalmente son amistades o vecinos. Además que los fines de semana viaja a otras ciudades para seguir vendiendo, y de esta manera tener más ingresos. Para ello, Bivian cría a sus cuyes con una buena alimentación, hasta el momento está muy  contenta, y desea continuar adelante, mejorando e implementando su granja de cuyes. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de este banco comunal porque es una de las mujeres emprendedoras de su zona. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más cuyes de raza y jaulas para ellos.
texts.en:
Bivian is 37 years old and lives with her 7 year old son in her own home. For the last 3 years she has applied herself to the sale of guinea pig meat, she has her own breeding nursery and attends to all of the sales inquiries that are usually from friends or neighbors. In addition to this, she travels on weekends to continue selling and through this makes more money. For all this, Bivian breeds her guinea pigs with good nutrition, and for the moment she is pleased and wants to move forward improving her guinea pig farm.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan with MFP. She was invited to become part of the communal bank because she is one of the enterprising women of her area. The money she requests is for the purchase of more ethnic race guinea pigs and cages.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more ethnic race guinea pigs / Compra de cuyes de raza

loans.name: Bélange

texts.fr: Bélange D. est une femme mariée, âgée de 32 ans ayant à sa charge 3 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissu teinté « Thioup » et souhaiterait renforcer son commerce afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Bélange D. is a married woman, aged 32, responsible for 3 children. She sells dyed cloth known as "Thioup". She would like to bolster her business so as to be better able to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of dyed cloth known as "Thioup"

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: ce monsieur est un enseignant, il est marié et père d’un enfant, le revenu de sa profession ne lui permet pas de prendre en charge sa famille, il a alors commencé en 2005  la vente de produits congelés, actuellement ce commerce marche bien pour lui et il ne peut satisfaire ses clients avec le stock dont il dispose, raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 cartons de produits congelés.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a teacher. He is married and the father of a child. The income from his profession doesn't allow him to provide for his family. So he started selling frozen goods in 2005. Currently, this business is going well for him. But with the inventory he has, he can't satisfy his customers. This is why he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy twenty boxes of frozen goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy frozen goods

loans.name: Mirabdulla

texts.en:
Mirabdulla A. is 48 years old and is married with three sons. From the time he was young, Mirabdulla has been learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children. He hopes to see them develop into professional, ethical, and hardworking people. For this reason, he is asking a loan of $1,200. He wants this loan in order to buy additional livestock. Be an important part of the growth of Mirabdulla’s business.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Ouyètiè 7 Group

texts.fr:
Ouyètiè 7 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Nitabogoro de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies, ont en moyenne 36 ans et  sont mères d’au moins 6 enfants. 
Elles cultivent  principalement   de l’arachide et du mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 7 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide et de mil, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 7 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ouyètiè 7 is a group of married women of the village of Nitabogoro in Koutiala City, Region of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families, and they average 36 years of age and are the mothers of at least six children. The women mainly grow peanuts and millet. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. After having correctly repaid the first loan, they are now on their second farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting peanuts and millet; some minor supplies and equipment; and some fertilizers and the like, for farming. These items are procured at the grand marketplace of Koutiala. Following the off-season, the harvests are stored for a time, so that they gain in value. And then they are sold at the same marketplace and at surrounding marketplaces at the retail level (often wholesale), in cash transactions, to customers generally from large cities. The group members each intend to realize, after selling their produce, an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Tem K., 40, sells sugar cane juice from her home in Prey Veng province. She is married with two children who are still living at home. Her husband, pictured here, works as a moto-taxi driver. She typically makes about $3 US each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for $800 US to purchase more sugar cane to sell. Some of the loan will be used to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar cane

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola trabaja como vendedora de comida; tiene un puesto de venta ubicado en su misma zona donde vende almuerzos. El esposo trabaja de ayudante albañil estas dos actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos con lo cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo de dos años y su madre de la tercera edad. Viven en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la Zona Villa Cooperativa de  la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos por cantidad (fideo, arroz, papa), para ahorrar en los costos y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el Primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del crédito solicitado por Yola.
texts.en:
Yola works as a food seller. She has a stand located in her own zone; she sells lunches. Her husband works as an assistant bricklayer. These two activities are their source of income to support her small two year old son and her elderly mother. They live in a rented house in the Villa Cooperativa zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy quantities of ingredients (noodles, rice, potatoes) in order to save on costs and improve income. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation shows that Yola qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy noodles, rice, potatoes, and other ingredients for her food selling business

loans.name: Abdulboid

texts.ru: Перимов Абдулбоид  проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абдулбоид более 4 лет работал по специальности "бухгалтером". В данный момент он более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает арбуз и лук. Кредит просит для сбора урожая и повторного посева.
texts.en:
Abdulboid P. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. Abdulboid had worked as an accountant for over 4 years. Currently, he has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He grows watermelons and onions. He is requesting a loan for harvesting and new sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and new sowing

loans.name: Las Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Unidas está conformado por Lidia del Socorro V. G., Vilma del Carmen M. C. y Yolanda del Carmen B. R., tres mujeres provenientes de  la Comarca Los Altos; Ubicada en la carretera a Tipitapa. Este Grupo, inicia ya el Treceavo ciclo de crédito con ADIM y se sienten orgullosas de su trabajo desempeñado a lo largo de estos tres años.

La coordinadora es Doña Lidia V., de treinta y cinco años de edad, quien emprendió hace cinco años el reto de crear  su propio negocio, ya que su trabajo en La Zona Franca de Tipitapa  no le proporcionaba el dinero suficiente para las necesidades de su hogar. Así decidió iniciar la venta de granos básicos en su casa y ha ido incrementando la variedad de productos con cada ciclo de crédito en ADIM.

Doña Vilma M. quien vende cosméticos de la Zermat en la Zona Franca y Doña Yolanda B. quien distribuye cosméticos de la Vogue en su comarca, son las otras dos integrantes del grupo. Ellas creen poder seguir creciendo a través de los créditos y capacitaciones que han recibido
texts.en:
The Las Unidas group is formed by Lidia del Socorro V. G., Vilma del Carmen M. C. and Yolanda del Carmen B. R.. These three women are from the Los Altos region, which is located on the highway to Tipitapa. This group is starting their thirteenth loan cycle with ADIM. They feel proud of their work for having managed it over three year. Lidia V. is the coordinator. She is 35 years old. Five years ago she undertook the challenge of starting her own business. She did this because her work in the Zona Franca de Tipitapa did not provide enough money for her household necessities. She decided to start selling basic grains in her house. She has been increasing the variety of products with each loan cycle with ADIM. Vilma M. sells Zemat cosmetics in the Zona Franca. Yolanda B. distributes Vogue cosmetics in her region. They believe that they can keep growing through the loans and trainings they have received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Keep stocking her mini market to increase the level of sales

loans.name: Cristian Maria

texts.es: Cristian Maria C. J. tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general es una joven de 48 años. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por lo que tenía 4 hijos que mantener. Ella ha comercializado mercadería por encargo y siempre ha mantenido estabilidad en el negocio y su buen record. Cristian tiene muchos clientes y en su mayoría son jóvenes, además tiene a su hermana quien le ayuda a mostrar sus productos y juntas han logrado realizar lo necesario para mantener a la familia. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, cremas, calzado y ropa interior. Su mayor deseo es seguir con este negocio ya que la situación es muy difícil y ella quiere lograr lo que se propone.
texts.en:
Cristian Maria C. J. is a general merchant and is 48 years old. She began this business because she had 4 children for which to care. She has sold by order and has always maintained stability in her business, and a good record. Cristian has many customers, the majority of which are young. In addition, her daughter helps her to show her products and together, they have been able to achieve what is necessary to support the family. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, creams, footwear, and underwear. Her biggest dream is to continue with the business, since the situation is very difficult and she wants to achieve what she has set out to do.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beware About Us Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel G. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Beware About Us'. He is 27 years old and an elementary school drop-out due to the civil crisis. Emmanuel is also single and has no child but wants to catch up with life. He lives and does business in the Bassa community area, which is close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

This community is known as very old settlement where people leave the Grand Bassa county (a county in southern Liberia) to settle because people of that community speak the same dialect they speak; it is also known as a community where people fight poverty to change their lives.

Money exchange, charging mobile phones batteries, and selling GSM recharge credits to the residents of Bassa community is Emmanuel’s business. He has been doing this business for 2 years and started with LD$6000.00 and is still moving forward.

Emmanuel always keeps his business environment clean and tidy; that’s why his customers continue coming back to do business with him and that makes business go forward.

Emmanuel needs this loan to buy more mobile phone chargers, GSM recharge cards wholesale, and to increase the cash he uses to exchange currencies in order to improve his business. Emmanuel wants to reach a higher level in business and dreams of changing his life to a better one where he can help others.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phone chargers, GSM recharge cards wholesale, etc.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: 25-year-old Kenneth C. has been concerned about the future of her two children once she will be depending her family’s economy to her husband’s sporadic livelihood. She then wanted to have her own business to manage to be able to help her husband who is farm laborer generates income for her family. She joined ASHI to be able to have the opportunity to request for a loan which will enable her to start up a sari- sari store (variety store) in her own house.  Profits she will be making out of this will be saved and will be re invested in the business while her children are still young whose age range is from two to four years old. By the time her children will be needing much bigger finances for their studies until college, Kenneth wishes that her business by then have grown through loans she received from ASHI and its partner, KIVA.

loans.use: Will be used for purchasing variety store's inventory of goods for starting up.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel D. is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Jocel is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Jocel raises crops. The main source of income for this business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jocel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocel joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jocel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena G. was born in Larion Alto in Tuguegarao City. She is happily married to Melchor G., who is a local laborer in their village. They are blessed with two children; Abigail, age 16, who is a first year college student studying Information Technology and Claribel, age 15, who is a senior high school student.

Magdalena has a dressmaking business. She is 57 years old and she has been in this business for 30 years. Farming provides the income that supports the needs of their family. 

To help her husband meet the daily needs of their family, she started the business that she knows best. With God's help, she was able to start her sewing business which helps her to support the educational needs of her children. She now wants to borrow PHP 5,000 to maintain her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for making local beer.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
La señora jabiela pertenece al banco D. emprendimiento las solidarias, es un banco que esta en su 2do ciclo. La señora es la presidenta del banco esta conformado por 10 integarntes, es una persona joven y bastante dinamica su mercaderia es vendida en la ciudad D. Riberalta y se debe mencionar que esta estudiando odontologia en la universidad UDABOL y recibe el apoyo D. sus padres para cubrir las pensiones octavo semestre. con los ingresos que percibe por su negocio ella llega a cubrir los gastos personales que tiene.				
CARMEN, es la tesorera en el banco y ella trabaja medio tiempo como empleada del hogar en la zona San Pedro y medio tiempo es pasanaquera, vale decir que entrega mercaderia a requerimiento y la forma D. pago es a facilidades, tiene la modalidad D. pagos. Tiene un hijo y esta seperada D. su esposo, con el prestamo aumentará su capital, mejorando D. esta forma su calidad D. vida. Se observa en la señora muchos deseos D. superacion.						
MIRIAM, Es la secretaria del banco, ella tiene dos hijos y trabaja en la venta D. productos D. belleza, con el prestamo ha logrado comprar en cantidad sus productos que estaban en oferta como ser perfumes, desodorantes,talcos y otros, lo que permitirá mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en la casa D. sus padres y no paga alquileres, el esposo trabaja como taxista.
texts.en:
Sra. Jabiela is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Solidarias”, which is in its second loan cycle. She serves as the president of this Communal Bank, which consists of 10 members. Jabiela is a young and dynamic person who sells merchandise in the city of Riberalta. It should be mentioned that she is studying dentistry at UDABOL (University of Aquino Bolivia) and receives support from her parents to cover her room and board for the eighth semester. The income she generates from her business is used to cover her personal expenses.

Carmen is the treasurer of the Communal Bank. She works part-time as a housekeeper in the San Pedro area and part-time as a “pasanaquera”, which means she delivers merchandise and provides different payment options to her customers, including installment plans. Carmen has a son and is separated from her husband. Her loan will increase her capital and help improve her quality of life. She is very determined to succeed.

Miriam is the secretary of the Communal Bank. She has two children and sells beauty products. With her loan, she will purchase products in bulk that are being provided through special offers such as perfumes, deodorants, talcum powders, and other items. The additional inventory will help improve her income. Miriam lives in her parents’ house and does not pay rent. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 42 years old; she lives with her husband and 3 children in Guarari, Heredia, a poor region located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. She is applying for a loan of 300,000 colons, and this will be her first loan with Fundacion Mujer.

At first glance, one would not be able to tell, but Jacqueline has a chronic illness called fibromyalgia, a virus affecting her muscular abilities. She has been sick for roughly 10 years. In order to fight the pain brought on by her illness, she takes up to 15 pills every day. The pills help; but the best therapy, she says, is her work. By staying busy with her candle-making, among other things, she can avoid taking so many pills, which leave her very tired and feeling weak. Jacqueline, or Jacky as it reads on her business cards, finds candle-making to be therapeutic as well as a means to generate income which helps pay household expenses and put her children through school. Her faith and her business are what get her out of bed every day and keep her motivated to take on life’s challenges with an optimistic outlook.

Jacky has eleven years' experience in the sales business; candle-making she has started relatively recently and has found it to be both profitable and rewarding. Jacky could not afford to take any formal candle-making classes, so she taught herself through trial and error. She can sell her candles for up to 8500 colons each. Her candles sell fast and she earns much more than she did working at the local mall. In a 12 hour day, she used to earn 7,000 colons working in a shop. Selling her candles, she can earn up to 350,000 colones per month. It takes her 2 days to make 8 candles.

This loan would be used to purchase raw materials and molds necessary for the creation of her beautiful candles.
