Recently, Jacky has received an abundance of orders for a specific type of candle she makes, with butterfly decorations. In order to respond to this surge in demand, she would like to purchase 2 more molds necessary to the creation of these candles. The molds cost 11,000 colons each. At the moment she has many different molds which she uses to create a variety of colorful, scented candles. This loan will help Jacqueline to take advantage of opportunities for increase sales associated with the Christmas season.

Under the business name ¨Creaciones Jacky,¨ Jacky and her son, Alonso, have put together a homemade catalog with pictures of the candles Jacky has created. When he isn’t studying chemistry at the National University, Alonso helps his mother sell her products to shops in the nearby mall.

Jacky is a true entrepreneur. Whether she is making candles, painting ceramics, promoting her products or taking care of the family, she is always doing something--and that´s the way she likes it.

loans.use: purchase of materials necessary for candle-making

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Aun P. is 35 years old and she is a farmer who lives in Rayak village in Takeo province. She has three children, one of whom attends the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. She owns a 0.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Soviet Ouch, (shown on the right of the photo) is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns a little money to support his family. In his business, he now faces a problem because it costs him a lot of money to buy petroleum to support his old motorbike. Thus, Mrs. Sreyaun P. is asking for a loan from AMK to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one in order to save money on petroleum.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one

loans.name: God's Goodness Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh B. K. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God’s Goodness. She is 40 years old and is busy with 3 children aged 15-22 years old. Their educational level is 4th-6th grade. She also cares for 2 nieces. Kebbeh and her family live in the Red-light Sore Clinic community. She had to leave school after 8th grade due to poverty.

Kebbeh’s business is the sale of rice. She buys rice in large bags and sells it at retail prices by the cup in the Red-light market, which is the biggest market in Paynesville, Liberia. She has been running this business for 18 years and hopes to start importing rice to Liberia in the near future. Kebbeh started her rice-selling business with 500 Liberian Dollars given to her by her mother. She is very friendly and talks to customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Kebbeh needs this loan to add to her capital and improve her business. She dreams of helping her children as much as she can, in order for them to have a good future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kebbeh is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima A. sells beauty products and soaps in the Agoé region of Lomé, Togo. She is married to a taxi driver, and they have one child. Mrs. A. began this business in 2000 and is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to resupply her stock of soaps and beauty products. This loan will help Mrs. A. support her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and soaps.

loans.name: Rosa Arabel

texts.es: Rosa Arabel R. S. de 45 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual se dedica a trabajar como mecánico automotriz, y junto a sus 4 hijos de 16, 13, 11 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar en la escuela del lugar. Rosa posee una venta de huevos, fruta pelada y cortada en trocitos, y algunas golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en una de las calles principales del lugar la cual se encuentra enfrente de su casa. Debido a la dura situación a la cual se enfrentaba su familia, ya que el sueldo de su esposo no daba abasto con todos los gastos familiares, Rosa decidió aprovechar la excelente ubicación de su hogar, y emprender un nuevo negocio, en el cual en la actualidad, posee muchos clientes a pesar de que su venta es poca. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar huevos, dulces, más fruta, bolsas plásticas para colocar la fruta y otros productos más los cuales aún no posee, esto lo hace con el fin de poder aumentar sus ventas y brindarle una mejor ayuda a su esposo.
texts.en:
45-year old Rosa Arabel R. S. lives in the municipality of Lourdes Colón in the department of La Libertad with her husband who is a motor mechanic and their four children aged 16, 13, 11, and 8. They are all students in local schools. Rosa runs a stall selling eggs, ready-to-eat fruit (peeled and sliced), and candy. The business is located on one of the main streets of the town, right in front of her house. Because of the financial difficulties that the family were facing--her husband’s income didn’t cover the family’s expenses--Rosa decided to take advantage of the excellent location of the house and start a new business. Now she has many customers although sales are low. For this reason she would like a loan to buy eggs, candy, more fruit, plastic bags in which to put the fruit, and other items that she does not sell at the moment. Her goal is to increase her sales and provide greater assistance to her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy eggs, candy, and fruit

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase some piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Yusup

texts.ru: Курбонов Юсуп проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын на зарабатках в России. Сам Юсуп более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Yusup K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 51 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. His son works in Russia. Yusup has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. He breeds cattle to resell it for meat. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Luis Alexander

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Bogotá hay un  sector  histórico llamado  la Candelaria  con hermosas construcciones patrimonio de la ciudad, casas, museos y callejones empedrados que albergan pequeños y grandes almacenes de joyas además de otros negocios que también coexisten.  Este es el ambiente físico donde está instalado Luis C. O., de 28 años  de edad, con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años, dedicado a  la compra y venta de metales preciosos como oro y plata, desde hace tres años cuando se independizó de su trabajo como empleado en una joyería y emprendió la suya propia como alternativa de autosostenimiento. 
El negocio de  Luis se basa en la compra y venta de oro y plata por gramo, que hace  a chatarreros y diferentes proveedores, en cuya transacción genera su utilidad; como siempre requiere efectivo disponible para aprovechar las oportunidades del mercado y fluctuaciones del precio de estos metales, está solicitando su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en la compra de material de oro y plata a recicladores y chatarreros que son su mejores proveedores.

 Su sueño es continuar sus estudios universitarios, pero antes debe lograr una solvencia económica aceptable a través de su trabajo en la joyería. Su desafío más importante es compartir tiempo con su familia ya que cada día se torna más difícil lograrlo.
texts.en:
In the city of Bogota there is an area called Candelaria with beautiful historic city buildings, houses, museums and narrow cobblestone streets where small and large jewelry stores are found, as well as other types of shops. This is the physical location where Luis C. O., 28, lives with his wife and 4-year-old son, and where he works buying and selling precious metals such as gold and silver. He has been here for the last three years when he left his job as an employee in a jewelry store and went out on his own as a means of becoming self-supporting. His business is based on buying and selling gold and silver by the gram bought from scrap merchants and suppliers, and that's how he makes his profit. As always he needs available cash to be able to take advantage of the opportunities of the price fluctuations in the market of these metals. He is requesting a loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which he will use to buy gold and silver from the recyclers and scrap merchants who are his best suppliers. His dream is to continue his university studies but first he must succeed in becoming financially solvent with his jewelry business. His most important goal is to spend time with his family but each day that is becoming more difficult.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold and silver

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Kokowi

texts.en:
Kokowi A. owns a restaurant in Lomé where he makes spaghetti, rice dishes, and other popular Togolese meals. The restaurant has been open since 2006, though this is his first micro-loan from WAGES.

Kokowi is married to another merchant and they have three children. He has requested this loan of 300,000 CFA that he plans to use to purchase milk, couscous, spaghetti, sugar, and other staples of his restaurant’s menu.

loans.use: To purchase food for his restaurant

loans.name: Allah Malalyah Group

texts.en:
Saah J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Allah Malalyah". He is 36 years old and single. He was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of support. For 2 years, he has been selling used leather belts in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He describes himself as jovial.

Saah J. plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollars (LRD) portion of this 32,000 LRD group loan to buy more used leather belts. His goal is to expand his business and open a store.

loans.use: To buy more used leather belts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for help with plowing and weeding, and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita N. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 42 years old and is widowed with three school-aged children. Marita owns and operates a business cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Marita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Marita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris M. is 27 years-old.  She is a resident of Shingila and a Tailor in Kilifi town kwa Karanja.

Peris is married to Karisa Kashindo who supports her and they have two children aged four and eight years respectively.

She has been in business for the last ten years and is now requesting her second loan from Kiva partner KADET.

She plans to increase her stock of cloth materials for her shop and then use the anticipated profit to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

In the future, Peris would like her business to provide an employment opportunity for someone and to succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan A. is a farmer. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Gulshan puts a lot of enthusiasm into the development of her farming efforts and cattle breeding because she is aware that they can help her children.  

She sells fattened cattle to the local butchers and fruits to the local bazaar traders. Her monthly income is about $250-$315 and it is not enough to cover basic family needs. The unconditional support that she receives from her children provides her with optimism, and despite the financial shortcomings at home she tries to alleviate those shortcomings efficiently. 

Her wish to improve the living conditions of her family brings her to request a loan to increase the quality and quantity of her products. Gulshan asks for a loan of 600 AZN. She wants to purchase one milk cow and seeds.

loans.use: purchase one milk cow and seeds

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Gloria is married and has seven adult children. Gloria owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia K. is a 28 year old married lady with two children. She operates a tailoring shop in Sita, Malindi. She was introduced to KADET LTD by  one of the  clients of KADET. 

She is now applying for  her second loan of Kshs 30,000 and she plans to buy a modern sewing machine and materials for making clothes. Lydia hopes that, by doing this, her business will grow and she will be able to use the anticipated profit to help support her family as well as establishing  the business .In the future hopes to grow her business and own a boutique.

loans.use: To buy a modern sewing machine and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Ventura Del Carmen

texts.es: Ventura del Carmen tiene 64 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y que disfruta mucho de tener este negocio como es una pulpería. Anteriormente había tenido experiencia con su negocio. Pues ha sido muy difícil mantenerlo activo, pues algunas veces no obtiene muchas ganancias. Esto no la entristece le proporciona mas ánimo para esforzarse y brindar un buen servicio. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, es su principal fuente de ingresos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en: Ventura del Carmen is 64 years old. She is a very dynamic woman who truly enjoys running her business, which is a pulpería, or a small grocery store. She did not have any previous experience with this type of business, so it has been difficult to keep it going and sometimes she hasn't made much profit. This doesn't sadden her, though, but rather gives her more encouragement to put in effort and to offer good service. She has had this business for over 7 years and it is her principal source of income. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to buy candy, soft drinks, juices, detergent, and staple grains.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, juices, detergent, and staple grains

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah R. is 38 years old. She is married to Wilson, and they have seven children from 5 to 15 years old. Sarah has been running a kiosk for about five years. She earns monthly income of KES 2,000. 

She is applying for her first loan of KES 10000 from KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to expand the business and she will invest the anticipated profit back into the business. She dreams of having a big business and a well-managed family.

loans.use: Use to purchase business stock

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; tiene 34 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa interior, ella vende medias, truzas y polos y luego los distribuye a las diferentes tiendas de venta de ropa, la socia también trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurant turístico, la socia quiere aumentar el negocio de venta de ropa. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "Los Líderes" ["The Leader"]. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The partner is Mrs. Sonia. She is 34 years old, lives with her significant other and has three children. She alternates her daily activities. With the business of selling underwear, she sells stockings, under garments, and polo shirts. Then she distributes them to the different clothing stores. The partner also works as an assistant chef in a tourist restaurant. She wants to grow the clothing sales business. She asks for the loan to buy clothing merchandise.

The partner is thankful for the requested loan and promises to follow through with the payments of her dues in the established installments.

loans.use: The partner asks for the loan to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en:
Kubra M. A. lives in Arifwala, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the area named 69-EB in a two-room brick house. She supports her family financially through her cosmetics business. She runs a shop near her home where she sells  products such as lipsticks, eye liners, mascara and nail polishes to her clients. 

She is the mother of two daughters. Her elder daughter is studying in eighth class while her younger one is in fifth class.

Kubra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his business of selling construction supplies. This is her first loan. He mainly receives orders from construction companies and gets good profits by completing them on time. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies like sand, bricks and cement in bulk quantity that will help him to fulfill larger orders on time and serve more clients. 

Kubra is hopeful that the investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and he will be able to earn more income for the family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kubra.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her husband's construction supplies business

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina H. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Merlina is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Merlina owns and operates a retail store, selling seafood products including fish like sardines and mackerel. Merlina has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish like milk fish and sardines. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Merlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for resale

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda R. is from the village of Brgy. Magsaysay, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Merlinda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Merlinda runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Phillippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Merlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a shop and make her own beauty salon

loans.name: Chandoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chandoeun C. (pictured) is 31 years old.  Her husband, Mr. Ly Phoeun, is 43 years old.  They have been married for ten years and have two children – one son and one daughter, both of whom are in school. The family lives in a suburb approximately 25 kilometeres from Phnom Penh.

Chandoeun is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to go to work

loans.name: Sheikha

texts.en:
Sheikha is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and transportation. 

She has been operating a tailoring business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Sheikha faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to purchase more materials for tailoring in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for tailoring business

loans.name: Idibek

texts.en:
S. Idibek is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. For almost 10 years, Idibek has been working as a market vendor. He sells plates and dishes of the oriental style. This kind of the goods is in popular demand among the population. This kind of china is widely used for girls' dowries and also for family celebrations. 

His love for his children is the biggest reason for Idibek to make an effort to provide what they need. Now Idibek is planning to enlarge the range of goods and to purchase more china to expand his inventory. With this purpose in mind, he requests 12,000 Somoni. The well-being of Idibek’s family and his business are in your hands. Idibek and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing plates and dishes in oriental style

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.en:
Zulaikho is married. She sells fruit at a market in the small city of Kanibadam. She has been in this business for 10 years. She always offers her clients good and fresh food products, providing them with what they need. 

Zulaikho is a hard-working and enthusiastic person. She wants to continue her business to make a living for her family. Zulaikho would like to borrow 8000 Somoni to increase her inventory. There are many celebrations in April and May and demand for her products grows. 

Zulaikho has gained a reputation for responsibility with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business.

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to expand the range of fruits she sells.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen V. trades in computers from a big rented shop. 

Karen purchases the computers from various sources to be able to meet the diverse suburban demand. 

Currently he is planning to enlarge the assortment in order to attract more customers. This loan will help Karen to pay for the computers.

Karen is the only breadwinner in his family. Karen’s wife looks after their two children.

loans.use: to buy computers for resale

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Ernesto de 49 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor por venir. Los campos que posee Lidia son las mejores y las tiene bien cuidadas, es así que todos los días  se levanta para prepara el desayuno para sus hijos que se van al colegio, luego ella y su  esposo  se prepara para dirigirse a los campos a cultivar las plantas café, cacao, palillo y barbasco, productos que posteriormente lleva a comercializarlos a los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de San Francisco y Kimbiri. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para pasear por los verdes campos de su poblado, lleva 22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas quienes se encargan de dañar  los capullos de las plantas. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal es un socia, muy alegre y cooperadora. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará insecticidas para la fumigación de insectos que afectan sus cultivos.
texts.en: Lidia is 46 years old and a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Ernesto, age 49, and their 4 beloved children, for whom they would like to provide a better future. Lidia's farmlands are the best, and she keeps them well cared-for. Every day she gets up to make breakfast for her children who go to school. Later, she and her husband get ready to go out to the fields to cultivate their coffee, cacao, palillo [perfume guava] and barbasco plants, products which she later takes to sell in the wholesale centers located in the cities of San Francisco and Kimbiri. What she likes most about her work is the freedom she has to wander through the green fields of her village. She has been doing this work for 22 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is protecting her crops from the pests which attack the buds of the plants. With time, she would like to buy more land to increase her production. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make all of her payments punctually if she would like to have access to another loan afterward. In her communal bank, she is a very cheerful and cooperative member. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy insecticides to fumigate her crops against the insects that affect them.

loans.use: to buy insecticides to fumigate her crops

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly, 40 years old, is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 11 years old and the youngest is 4 months.

Shirly is a farmer and so is her husband. They work together to sustain their family. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Shirly said she joined CEVI because they really need funding for the farm. She is requesting a loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Shirly hopes for her children to finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Titonangba Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TITONANGBA est composé de deux personnes qui vivent toutes dans la même zone géographique à Zongo à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin). Ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Roukayatou est celle se trouvant à droite sur la photo. Roukayatou est née en Décembre 1986 à Cotonou. Roukayatou vit depuis sa naissance dans le quartier Zongo. Roukayatou n’est pas marié, mais a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit avec elle. Afin de se prendre en charge et d’assurer les charges de son enfant, Roukayatou achète des cartes de recharge téléphonique en gros et les vend à son domicile. Roukayatou exerce cette activité depuis deux ans. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire et leur revenu, Roukayatou et son groupe sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The TITONANGBA group is composed of two person, who both live in the same geographic area, Zongo, in Cotonou (Benin's economic capital). This group is requesting ALIDe's financial support to increase their level of activity. The group's leader, called Roukayatou, is the woman on the right in the picture. Roukayatou is born in December 1986 in Cotonou. Roukayatou has lived in the Zongo neighborhood since she was born. Roukayatou is not married, but she has a child who goes to school and lives with her. To support herself and provide for her child's expenses, Roukayatou purchases prepaid phone cards wholesale and retails them from her house. Roukayatou has been active in this business for two years. In order to raise their level of activity and to increase their sales and revenues, Roukayatou and her group are requesting a loan from ALIDe for the first time.

loans.use: to purchase prepaid phone cards

loans.name: Oprecida

texts.en:
Oprecida is from the village of San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old. Oprecida is single. 

To make a living, Oprecida owns and operates a general store. Oprecida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Oprecida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Oprecida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Oprecida is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods and house chore needs. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Oprecida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods and house chore needs.

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbold is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  His two children attend a secondary school. Mr. Enkhbold is mining engineer and he works for Olon Ovoot Gold Mining company as a field operator. His family owns a plot of land and has a small family house on it. The house is small and old and since their children are growing up, they need more space and separate rooms. 

Enkhbold is building a bigger house for his family. The project was started last year and it was stopped due to lack of funding. The loan Enkhbold is asking for will be used to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, windows, insulation materials, stoves and pipes for a heating system to build a new house for his family. He is planning to build a green home which will use an  electric heating system instead of the traditional coal-fired stoves. The house will be more efficient in heating costs and will not emit smoke into the air.

loans.use: To buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, insulation materials, and roof tiles to build a new bigger house for his family.

loans.name: Mirdamat

texts.en: Mirdamat is a single man aged 21. He makes a living selling foodstuffs at his grocery store. His location is very good and he serves many customers because he is willing to work more than 12 hours a day. Mirdamat has been in this business for three years and knows a good deal about it. He is also very punctual and detail-oriented, character traits that help him in his business. Mirdamat can always figure out how much stock he needs so there is enough on hand to meet customer needs yet it is always fresh. Mirdamat has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions and to make savings to build his house.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Melinda has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, underwear and blouses. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stock like t-shirts and blouses.

Melinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Melinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Mouimatou

texts.fr:
Mouimatou est âgée de 41 ans .Elle est mariée à un revendeur. Elle a deux enfants.

Elle travaille comme revendeuse  depuis 1995.Elle achète des produits de mercerie au grand marché de Lomé qu’elle revend au marché de Zongo à Agoé.

Elle a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES  afin de s’approvisionner en produits de mercerie pour répondre aux attentes de  ses clients.
texts.en:
Mouimatou is 41 years old and is married to a retailer. She has two children. She has been working as a retailer since 1995. She makes her purchases of sewing supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé and resells them at the Zongo market in Agoé. 

Mouimatou has requested her second WAGES loan to stock up on sewing supplies in order to respond to the requirements of her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 52 years old and married to John and they have three school-going children. She has practiced farming for 20 years.
 
She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, she hopes to become a successful farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 39 years old and married with three children.

Cheryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Cheryl has borrowed and paid 25000 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 14 years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Cheryl aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino nació en la ciudad de Pisaq (Perú) y tiene 54 años de edad, él tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, él vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, él es chofer y trabaja para la municipalidad de Pisaq manejando un volquete, él y su esposa Balbina tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en preparar platos de comida. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Faustino requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, verduras, carne y otras cosas más. 
 
Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Faustino was born in the city of Pisaq (Peru). He is 54 years old. He has a common-law wife, with whom he has four children. He currently lives in the city of Pisaq, and that is also where he works. He is a driver, working for the municipality of Pisaq driving a truck. He and his wife Balbina also have a family business, which consists of preparing meals. He has pursued this business for several years, and it is going very well for him, thanks to the dedication he puts into his work. 

Faustino needs the loan to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat and other items. 
 
The “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank meets every thirty days in the Pisaq district of the province of Calca (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being an area with a lot of tourism and business activity, as well as for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu, is located there.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat and other items.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Divorcé et mère de 5 enfants, elle est une commercante basé dans un marché situé dans une petite localité a proximité d'une ville situé pas loin de la capitale du Sénégal. Son commerce est basée sur la vente de tissus de basins brodés. Avec ce crédit elle envisage de faire des achats pour rendre son stock de marchandises beaucoup plus riche afin de satisfaire l'attente de ces clients. S'approvisionnant en Gambie et aux HLM une marchée qui se trouve a Dakar ou les prix sont favorable .Elle évolue dans ce domaine depuis 2007 et avec cette expérience qu'elle a, elle voit son commerce prendre de l'envol c'est pour cette raison qu'elle a sollicité un prêt afin de répondre a ses exigences.
texts.en: A divorced mother of 5 children, Alimatou is a business woman based in the market of a small village located near a city not far from the capital of Senegal. She sells embroidered cloths and bowls. She is asking for this loan in order to purchase bulk quantities of merchandise in order to satisfy her clients. She stocks up in Gambia and at the HLM, a market in Dakar where the prices are favorable. She has been in this business since 2007 and hopes to continue expanding it, aided by this loan she is soliciting.

loans.use: purchase cloth for her stock

loans.name: Mira

texts.en: Mira is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she is married and has three children. She earns a living by running a shop where she sells clothing and beauty products from firms such as Natasha and Avon. She has been in this business for six years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Mira is a new member of HSPFI and has joined in the hope of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy more Avon and Natasha beauty items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Shirinbayim

texts.en:
Shirinbayim has a small shoe-sales business at Agsu market. She is married and has three children.

Shirinbayim has been in business for ten years and has worked hard over the years to develop a successful business to help meet the needs of her family and meet customer demand. She currently sells a selection of women’s shoes and clothes. Her husband helps her in her business and they work well together. Shirinbayim would like to expand her business to maximize the income from it. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of 1300 AZN. She has already demonstrated herself to be a good client with a positive credit history

loans.use: to purchase new inventory

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée à un militaire, et est mère de deux enfants.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis l’an 2000. Elle achète et revend les bijoux genres colliers, boucles d’oreille, gommettes, bagues à tous ces clients à la devanture de leur maison, ou comme ambulante à Lomé. Elle achète ces produits au grand marché de Cotonou au BENIN voisin. Elle est aidée par une personne dans l’exercice de son activité. 
Afi a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux de qualité pour sa clientèle.  Elle veut utiliser les profits supplémentaires de son activité à développer son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait avoir son propre  boutique de vente de bijoux. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit  contribuer au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 43-year old woman. Her husband is in the military, and she has two children. Afi has been working as vendor since 2000. She buys and resells jewelry, such as necklaces, earrings, hair elastics, and rings. She sells to all kinds of clients  in front of her house, or as a street vendor in Lomé. She buys these goods at the big market of Cotonou in the neighboring Benin. She is aided by one additional person in her business.

Afi has requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to purchase quality jewelry for her clients. She would lie to use additional profits   to grow her business. In the years to come, Afi would like to open her own jewelry store. She says that she plans to use her profits  to contribute to the family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”KANTUS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Patricia;  La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 7, 3 años de edad, la socia se dedica a la administración de sus tienda internet, la socia trabaja atendiendo en casa su internet, ella desea en esta ocasión invertir el crédito en la compra de artículos de librería, como papales, lápiz, borradores, cuadernos, plumones entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artículos de librería como cuadernos, papeles, lapiceros, lápiz entre otros útiles escolares.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantus” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 7 and 3). Patricia manages an Internet café in her home. On this occasion, she wants to invest in bookstore products such as paper, pencils, erasers, notebooks, pens, and other school supplies. Therefore, she is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Patricia is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payment on schedule.

loans.use: to buy paper, pencils, erasers, notebooks, pens, and other school supplies.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 38 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Deo has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Deo has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil for resale, and will help Deo to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Deo hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Deo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Deo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Phard

texts.en: Phard, 57, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Phard and her husband are farmers. Phard is requesting a loan of USD 550 to purchase more blacksmith equipment for her son to expand his business. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy blacksmith equipment for her son to expand his business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина – вдова, сама воспитала двух сыновей, которые уже взрослые и живут отдельно. Валентина много лет занимается выращиванием ранних овощей: уже на протяжении 13 лет она на 43 сотках садит рассаду в теплицах, а потом поле в 165 соток засаживает различными видами капусты и кукурузой. В хозяйство Валентина вложила 50 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль теперь составляет около 4 700 гривен в месяц. 

Кредит в 15 000 гривен необходим Валентине для того, чтобы закупить семена, пленку, агроволокно и дрова для своих теплиц. Благодаря улучшению условий в теплицах и своевременному ремонту каждой из них, Валентина сможет вырастить раннюю овощную продукцию высокого качества и быстро ее реализовать, получив при этом дополнительную прибыль.    
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Valentina is a widow; she brought up her two sons, who are now adults and live separately. Valentina has grown early-ripening vegetables for many years; for the past 13 years she has planted 43 acres of seedlings in a greenhouse and then plants different types of cabbage and corn in a field of 165 acres. Valentina has invested 50,000 hryvnia in her property. Her net income is now around 4,700 hryvnia a month. Valentina needs a loan of 15,000 hryvnia to purchase seeds, film, agricultural fiber, and firewood for her greenhouse. With improved conditions in the greenhouse and timely repair, Valentina will be able to grow high quality early-ripening vegetables and do so quickly, as a result, achieving a higher income.

loans.use: purchase seeds, film, agricultural fiber, and firewood for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
The word honor best describes Wilma. She is married to Arturo and together they care for their family farm. They have two children, Aldrich, who is 26 years old and Bernadeth, who is 24 years old. Aldrich has graduated from elementary school and Bernadeth graduated from college, but she is still unemployed due to the stiff employment competition in their area. They live in a community in Rizal province of Isabela. Agriculture is the main source of income for the people there.

Wilma and her husband farm different crops, including rice, corn and vegetables. In a week, they are able to earn at least P 1,000 from selling vegetables, which they harvest on their own. It takes them three to five months to harvest and then be able to sell the rice and corn crops.

To maintain their farming business and to avoid high-interest debts with other lenders, Wilma has asked for a loan of P 27,000 so she can finance their farming needs, like fertilizer and seed to grow. 

In the future, Wilma hopes that she can sustain the needs of her family, and expand her farm business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for her farming business

loans.name: Silueta De Cristal Group

texts.es:
El grupo Silueta de cristal lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ivania del Socorro quien tiene un taller de calzado el cual inicio hace un año junto a su esposo Juan. Ellos distribuyen su producto en Managua, León y Rivas  e invertirá el crédito en charol, pega, azulón, plantillas, suelas, montado y alistado…etc. 

Las otras integrantes son Ivania  quien se dedica al comercio de bebidas nacionales pozol, tiste y a la venta de verduras y Juan quien se dedica a la realización de calzado desde hace 7 años  y los comercializa en Granada y Managua.
texts.en:
The Silueta de Cristal communal bank is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising people.

Ivania del Socorro has a footwear shop, which she started a year ago with her husband, Juan.  They distribute their products in Managua, León, and Rivas.  She will use the loan to buy patent leather, glue, dye, insoles, soles, lasting, and other supplies.  

Ivani is another member.  She sells traditional drinks like “pozol” (corn based drink) and “tiste” (a drink made from corn and cocoa).  She also sells vegetables.  

Juan, who has been making shoes  for 7 years and sells them in Managua and Granada.

loans.use: to buy patent leather, glue, dye, insoles, soles, lasting, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Gina

texts.en:
Maria Gina is 58 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Maria Gina has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Maria Gina is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Perris would like to buy more materials for embroidery of loose covers

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Aunty Cici has been selling cloth for the past 25 years. She is a widow and has her eldest daughter in the university. She also looks after three other children who are all in school. She does this through the profit she makes by selling cloth. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has gone through the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $700 to expand her business so she can use the profit to look after her children.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
B. Muhabbat has worked in the retail business for 5 years. She has a technical secondary education from the cooperative technical school. She is divorced and has three children. Her elder daughter is in high school and Muhabbat is saving money for her college education. 
She started her business after the divorce when she needed money to raise her kids. First, she worked at the open-air market with a small variety of goods. Currently, she rents a location in the trading center. She used her first loan for the acquisition of goods, and did very well in the wedding and gift season. She would use this loan to increase the volume of goods and to expand her business by opening an additional business site.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory and open a second business site

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty K. is forty years of age, married with six children. She sells rope and string for local building construction, sharing a selling space with a friend. With six children, Mabinty struggles to provide her family with basic needs. Her husband sometimes assists with the selling of the items.

Mabinty and her husband would like to diversify their business but don’t have enough capital to do so. They would like to sell other building materials such as nails, padlocks, etc. and therefore are requesting a loan of $175.

loans.use: Diversify inventory of building materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Description of Business

Senora Maria has a small shop located in her home in her neighborhood of Flor de Bastion. She began her small business with a loan, and now sells all types of everyday products as well as ice cream which she makes and sells.

Use of Loan

She needs this loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale prices, as well to improve the image of her business by painting the outside of her house

Personal Information

Maria is 29 years old and has four sons, two of them are going to school. They live in a simple house made of reeds. They have a stable family life, and Maria's principal goal is to improve her business and be able to ensure a good future for her children.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Maria tiene una pequeña despensa ubicada en su domicilio en Flor de Bastión comenzó con su pequeño negocio con un préstamo, actualmente vende todo tipo de producto de primera necesidad y además hace helados que también pone a la venta.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería a precio de mayorista y además necesita mejorar la imagen de su negocio con una pintada de la fachada de su casa

Información Personal

Ella tiene 29 años y 4 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian su casa es de caña y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de mejorar su negocio para así asegurar un buen futuro a sus hijos

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Improve her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia is a very self-sacrificing and hard-working mother. 21 years ago she began her own family with Mario and now they have three school-age children under their protection. Her husband Mario is a miner in a mine very far from their home town, Juliaca. Meanwhile, Virginia is dedicated to taking care of their children and manning a small grocery store that offers a variety of items for basic needs. In her free time she also makes handicrafts, putting together beautiful traditional knitted sweaters. She is known for this work in the surrounding community. Her most important desire is to provide her children with a college education in the hope that they will be able to work in areas that they love and have a vocation. For this reason she hopes to grow and expand the variety of her merchandise and she is asking for a loan of $200, money that will permit her to increase her stock of products. Virginia is certain that with this injection of capital her business earnings will increase substantially. Your collaboration is very important in order for her plans to be realized.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia es una madre muy abnegada y trabajadora, desde hace 21 años formó su familia con Mario y ahora fruto de esa unión tiene bajo su protección a tres pequeños en edad escolar.Su esposo Mario se desempeña como obrero en una mina muy lejana de su ciudad natal, Juliaca y mientras tanto ella se dedica en brindarles cuidado a sus pequeños y a atender su bodeguita de abarrotes donde ofrece todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad; en sus ratos libres también se dedica a la artesanía, confeccionando hermosas chompas puesto que también es conocida por esa labor en las inmediaciones de su comunidad.Su deseo más importante es ofrecerle estudios superiores a sus hijos en un futuro con el objetivo de que puedan desempeñarse en las actividades para las cuales tenga mucha afición o cierta vocación, para esto anhela aumentar y ampliar la variedad de su mercadería y solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que le permitirá aumentar el stock de sus productos.Virginia está segura de que con esta inyección de capital a su negocio podrá aumentar sustancialmente su margen de ganancias.“Tu colaboración es muy importante para concretar sus planes”.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to expand stock of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To continue growing her business by selling breakfast and milk shakes made with fresh fruits.

loans.name: Kamuli B1 (A) Group

texts.en: Joy is married with three children. She owns a small drug shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to open up a clinic and start admitting patients.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura A., age 37, is married with 2 children (12 and 10 years old). Ashura owns a small bookstore, which she started 3 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 7 PM daily, she earns about $90 a month from this business.

In the past, Ashura successfully took out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to purchase books to sell for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Ashura belongs to a loan group called Nyota.

loans.use: To buy more books for her shop

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en:
Rahmat U. is 38 years old. He is married with three children.

Rahmat is a farmer. He has been working the land for more than 10 years. He now has 0,80 hectares of land, where he grows crops like garlic, onion, wheat, and others. The current business is his main source of income and generates a stable income for his family. Rahmat's father and wife are also involved in the business.

Now, with spring coming, Rahmat wants to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel for working the land. For this purpose, he requests 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. Rahmat is borrowing for the first time. He thanks everyone for trusting and supporting him and promises to be accurate when paying the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel to work the land and grow crops.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao P., age 51, is a widow who has been selling clothes in a busy market since 2000. On average, she makes around $2.60 a day of profit. She has nine children, six of who are married and live away from home, and three others, who are employed by garment factory with a salary of $80 each a month.

Mrs. Yem Thea is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase wood to repair the house, especially the leaking roof.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair the house.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
K. Margaret sells bags. She is a single parent of 4 children. Her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Her major challenge is the unavailability of a proper shop for her goods. Her goods are most often damaged by rain.

She is asking for additional capital to acquire a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: This loan will be for additional capital to acquire a shop to sell her goods.

loans.name: Norma Damaris

texts.es:
Young Norma G. E. is 19 years old, is a native of Bluefields, Nicaragua, and is single. For a year has been making a living selling perfumes and other beauty products from the Selsa company. This business functions as follows: based on orders, a Selsa company representative sends beauty products to young G. on credit and she is responsible to sell these and to pay for the products, for which they pay her a commission of 30% on the sales. In this way young Norma G. takes home this pay to help with the expenses of the house of her mother, who is a single parent. Nonetheless her main problem is that her clients who are mainly women, buy these products on payment terms (in two and three twice-monthly or monthly payments), thus although G. is selling a lot of products, her commission is small. It should be mentioned that young G. only sells these products since the orders that she makes out are for products ordered in advance and she only needs to deliver them once they are sent to her. It is for this that she needs a loan in order to buy these products which will permit her to make a profit of 60% on each item. She wants to buy: 4 bottles of Ferratt perfume at $10 each, 4 bottles of Mistery perfume at $50 each, 4 bottles of Esse perfume at $15 each, 4 bottles of papaya shampoo at $10 each, 6 containers of hair gel at $13 each, 4 dandruff shampoo at $11 each, 6 ladies’ deodorants at $4 each, and 3 acne lotions at $13 each.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La joven Norma G. E. tiene 19 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, es soltera y desde un hace un año se dedica a venderle perfumes y otros productos de belleza a la empresa Selsa. Este negocio funciona de la siguientes manera, una representante de la empresa Selsa le envia en base a solicitud productos de belleza a la joven G. al credito y esta se encarga de venderlo y cobrar el producto por lo cual le pagan una comision del 30 % sobre las ventas. De esta manera la joven Norma G. lleva este pago a su casa para ayudar en los gastos de la casa a su mama que es madre soltera. Sin embargo su problema principale es que sus clientes que son mas del genero femenino le compran estos productos con facilidades de pago (en dos y tres cuotas de pago quincenal y mensual), por lo que aun que vende bastantes productos, su comision es poca. Cabe mencionar que la joven G. vende estos productos ya que los pedidos que realiza son por encargos y solamente tiene que entregarlos una vez que se los envian. Es por esto que requiere de un financiamiento para poder comprar estos productos de los cuales les permite obtener una ganancia hasta del 60% por cada uno. Quiere comprar: 4 perfumes Ferratt a US$ 10 dolares cada uno, 4 perfumes Mistery a US$ 50 dolares cada uno, 4 perfumes Esse a US$ 15 dolares cada uno, 4 shampoo papaya a US$ 10 dolares cada uno, 6 gel para el cabello a US$ 13 dolares cada uno, 4 shampoo para la caspa a US$ 11 dolares cada uno, 6 desodorante para mujeres a US$ 4 dolares cada uno y 3 lociones Acne a US$ 13 dolares cada uno.

loans.use: Purchase 4 bottles of Ferratt perfume, 4 bottles of Mistery perfume, 4 bottles of Esse perfume, 4 bottles of papaya shampoo, 6 containers of hair gel, 4 bottles of dandruff shampoo, 6 ladies’ deodorants, and 3 acne lotions

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando dedicates himself to raising cattle, from which he then sells the milk at the PIL Andina milk plant.

He lives in the Huancollo community in the Tihuanacu section, about three hours from the city of La Paz.

He lives with his wife and two children, ages 3 and 1, respectively.

The loan would be used to purchase a milk cow of better quality. With this purchase, he plans to improve his income levels and have the opportunity to increase the volume of his milk production and sales to PIL Andina.

This is his first credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rolando se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive. en la comunidad Huancollo del sector de Tihuanacu provincia Ingavi a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada. De esta forma planea mejorar su nivel de ingresos al tener la posibilidad de aumentar su volumen de producción de leche y venderla a PIL Andina. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Mrs. Trang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. B. Thi Huyen Trang (ID: 030028), aged 23, would like to borrow a loan of 2.950.000 VND to run the business. She and her husband are very active and industrious. She purchases ingredients for her husband to make popcorns and sells them to other people in her neighborhood, who bring them to the market and sell them there. By doing this, Mrs. Trang has created job opportunities for people in her neighborhood as well as earned a stable income for her family. Mrs. Trang is very interested in joining SEDA so that she can request loans to expand her business. Her family’s daily income is about 130000 VND. Other members in her group include:

-Mrs. Nghiem Thi Sinh (ID: 030029) would like to borrow 2.950.000 VND to open a tailor shop.

-Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thom (ID: 030030) would like to borrow 2.950.000 VND to purchase ingredients to make popcorns.

-Mr. Nguyen Manh Tuong (ID: 030031) would like to borrow 2.950.000 VND to purchase steels to make doors.

-Mrs. N. Thi Thuy (ID: 030023) would like to borrow 2.950.000 VND to purchase ingredients to make popcorns.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

chị Bùi thị huyền Trang năm nay 23 tuổi MS 030028, hai vợ chồng chị rất năng động, hằng ngày chị thường mua ngô về cho chồng ở nhà nổ bỏng để bán cho các chị em khác trong thôn mang đi chợ bán, công việc đó đã tạo công ăn việc làm cho nhiều chị em khác trong thôn.Đồng thời gia đình chị cũng có thu nhập thường xuyên, chị rất thích tham gia vay vốn của chương trình vì nó giúp chị có thêm vốn hỗ trợ trong việc mở rộng kinh doanh, tiết kiệm tiền, tạo cho chị thêm năng động, mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị từ 130.000 VND/ ngày . Lần này chị đăng ký vay ở mức 2.950.000 VND để kinh doanh. Trong nhóm của chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị N. thị Sinh MS 030029 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để lấy vốn làm thợ may
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thơm MS 030030 vay mức 2.950.000 VND về mua ngô nổ bỏng
  • anh Nguyễn mạnh Tưởng MS 030031 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để mua sắt làm cửa
  • chị Ngô thị Thuý MS 030023 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để mua ngô nổ bỏng bán

loans.use: vay vốn buôn bán

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder has a printing press in her home for 14 years now. He used to sell paper and printing supplies. He has also worked with metals, and so he felt encouraged to set up his own printing press. Wilder has a workshop in his house made up of small machines. In addition, he has the support of two people who work with him when he has many orders.

The loans he has requested have been invested as capital to buy the materials and supplies necessary to do his printing jobs.

Wilder would like to buy a new printing machine because the one he has is obsolete.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Wilder tiene una imprenta en su casa desde hace 14 años. Él antes vendía papel e insumos de imprenta. También ha trabajado haciendo trabajos con metales, por lo que luego se animó a poner su propia imprenta. Wilder tiene un taller en su casa implementado con pequeñas máquinas. Asimismo, cuenta con el apoyo de dos personas que trabajan con él cuando tiene bastantes pedidos.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha invertido como capital para invertir en los materiales e insumos que necesita para hacer sus trabajos de imprenta.

Wilder quisiera comprarse una máquina nueva de imprenta porque la que tiene es muy obsoleta.

loans.use: buy the materials and supplies necessary to do his printing jobs (Para invertir en los materiales e insumos que necesita para hacer sus trabajos de imprenta.)

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda P. is 30 years old and married with four children. She has many years of experience selling groceries. She has a general store in her village, and she sells to the public six days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~$291 USD).

Linda has benefited from two previous successful SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) loans. SPBD loans are Linda’s only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. She will use her loan to improve her business status and also to help pay for her kids' school fees. She desires to increase sales so that she may better financially support her family. Her husband also helps out with her business.

loans.use: To buy items to improve her business status and help financially support her family and pay for her kids' school fees.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es: Clemencia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos. Se viene dedicando desde hace 17 años, al negocio de la venta de artesanía en cera, para las fiestas patronales y la elaboración de bordados de los mantos para las estatuas de los santos de la ciudad. Clemencia se dedica a su trabajo gran parte del día, ya que cuando no está elaborando las artesanías en cera o los bordados, está haciendo los contactos para su distribución. Lo más difícil es la elaboración de los bordados, ya que requieren tiempo, dedicación y mucha paciencia para llegar a los resultados deseados, pero le gusta, ya que puede explotar toda su creatividad. Clemencia trabaja para poder brindarle a su familia un futuro esperanzador. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará material para elaborar sus tejidos y artesanías en cera, para expandir su negocio en el futuro y que sea una de las tiendas más concurridas por la población.
texts.en:
Clemencia is 35 years old and she lives with her husband and her two small children. She has been selling wax crafts for the past 17 years, selling mostly on national holidays. She also creates needlepoint vestments for the statues of the saints in the city. Clemencia dedicates a large part of her day to her work. When she is not making her wax crafts or her needlepoint she is creating new contacts for their distribution. The hardest part is the needlepoint, taking up a great deal of time, dedication and so much patience to achieve the required results. But she loves doing it because she can put to use her creativity. Clemencia works so that she can provide her family with a future filled with hope. With the funds from the loan she will purchase fabric to create her tunics and for her wax crafts. She will expand her business in the future and she hopes to be one of the most visited stores in her region.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric for tunics and to create wax crafts.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel tiene 39 años, vive con su esposa. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura junto a su esposa, salen muy temprano para buscar pastos verdes para sus animales, de esa manera mantenerlos saludables, ya que cada lunes se dedican a la venta de sus ovejas a la feria  ganadera de una localidad cercana a la suya. Para Gabriel esta es la forma de generarse ingresos, cuando espera la cosecha, cultiva tubérculos y granos, nos dice que trabajará en ello hasta que las fuerzas de su cuerpo lo acompañen. En el caso de Gabriel es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, sin embargo fue aceptado por los integrantes de su banco comunal porque conocen de su esfuerzo y dedicación. En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para comprar abono para la época de siembra que se acerca.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 39 years old and lives with his wife. Since he was older than 20, he has been involved in livestock farming and agriculture with his wife. They go out very early to look for green grass for his animals to keep them healthy, because every Monday they sell their sheep at the cattle fair in a location near them. This is how Gabriel generates income when he waits for the harvest. She grows tubers and grains; she says she will work on this as long as her body allows her to. This is Gabriel’s first loan with MFP. However, he was accepted by the members of the community bank because they know of his strength and dedication. At this time, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the harvest-time that is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his fields for cultivation

loans.name: Jerrylin

texts.en:
“I want to raise my children well. I want to provide for their needs and help them build a bright future,” says Jerrylin S., a 31-year-old mother of three children from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Concerned about her children’s education, she joined the CEVI credit program in order to start a business and earn a living for the family. Jerrylin knows that with her husband’s income as a tricycle driver, she would struggle to send all of their children to school.

Jerrylin raises pigs in their backyard and wants to increase her profits from this venture. She is also looking into some other lines of work to increase the family’s inadequate income.

She would like a loan of $175 to purchase piglets and feed. She believes that by taking good care of the pigs, she would earn enough income to address her family's  needs.

CEVI has provided Jerrylin with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, to help her grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Mận, 26 tuổi, ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Gia đình chị có một con nhỏ 5 tuổi. Hiện tại thu nhập của  gia đình phụ thuộc vào công việc chăn nuôi, buôn bán hàng tạp hoá và tiền công làm nghề cắt tóc của chồng với thu nhập  2.000.000/ tháng. Chị mới tham gia vào Quỹ từ tháng 12 năm 2008, chị mong muốn được vay vốn với mức là 5.000.000 để đầu tư vào buôn bán  nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Mận - 26 years old - lives in Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. She has a young child that is 5 years old. Currently, her family's incomes comes from the business of rearing livestock, buying/selling of general goods and her husband's haircutting business with an income of 2,000,000 VND per month. She just joined TYM Fund in December of 2008. She hopes to borrow 5,000,000 VND to invest into their retail business to increase her family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail Business

loans.name: Yadicone

texts.fr: Yadicone est agée de 36 ans elle est marie et mere de plusieurs enfants .pour gagner sa vie elle vend depuis cinq (5) ans  des tissus  teintés pour femmes.Les revenus tirés de son activité plus permettent de participer aux depenses du menage.le pret sollicité lui permettra de renforcer son activité par l'achat de nouveaux tissus.
texts.en:
Yadicone is 36 years old, married and the mother of several children. To earn a living she has been selling dyed fabrics for women for the last five years.
